skill_description: Referencing the original word lists from the original Speak and Spell hardware, this interactive game will test your spelling for a number of commonly misspelled words.  The original four levels are available.

From the creators of Question of the Day, Kids Quiz poses fun new questions everyday for children ages 5-12, from animals and science to brainteasers and fun facts. Kids Quiz is a great way for children to reinforce their learning and discover new things about the world.  Parents: visit our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/AlexaKidsQuiz to read FAQs, interact with other users, and provide feedback.

Family night gets an extra serving of patty-flippin’ fun with Nickelodeon’s SpongeBob Challenge memory game on Alexa! Join the Krusty Krab crew, and take orders from the hungry citizens of Bikini Bottom. Work alongside your favorite characters, including SpongeBob, Squidward, and Mr. Krabs. Get ready to be challenged as the customers' orders get harder and harder. Nautical nonsense awaits, so join the Krusty Krab crew today!   To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, start the SpongeBob Challenge”.   To quit, just say "Alexa, quit" anytime during the game.   The SpongeBob Challenge skill is for kids and fans aged 6+.   For issues, questions, or comments please email us at amazonalexa@nick.com. This skill is for all ages. It is sure to keep even the brightest young minds entertained and challenged. Kids Trivia is a voice interactive game in which questions are asked and two possible answers are given. Please respond with the number of the correct answer and this skill will let you know if you are correct. After the round is complete, Alexa will let you know your final score. Bring your friends and family along with you and see see who can get the higher score!

skill_name: True False Science Quiz for Kids
skill_description: Hello Geniuses, True False Science Quiz for Kids is a Alexa Skill for the Kids who are interested in Science stuff!! This skill will challenge you 20 questions to test your science knowledge. I hope you find it easy :) I hope you enjoy this.. all the best!!

In Kids Kitchen you can create fantastical and crazy food! Start off by saying what type of cake you want to make, add some interesting ingredients, boil, fry blend and mix, then stick it in the oven, decorate and serve it to your friends!

Fun interactive dancing game for kids aged 3+. If your kid likes dancing, they will love kid dancer! Kid Dancer includes six fun levels: *Jungle *Outer Space *Desert *City *Ocean *Fairyland Loved by ages: 3-8! Did you like the game? Please leave us a review!

Did you know that a blue whale's heart weighs 400 pounds? Test your knowledge of wild and weird facts about animals, people, places and more in Nickelodeon’s No Way That’s True skill on Alexa! Go head-to-head with up to 4 players in this crazy trivia game that zips you around the globe. Along the way you’ll encounter SpongeBob, Lincoln Loud, and more of your favorite Nickelodeon characters, visit some of the world's most amazing places, and learn crazy facts about the planet we all call home. It's the game that will have you saying, "No way that's true!" To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, open No Way That’s True.” To quit, just say "Alexa, quit" anytime during the game. The No Way That’s True skill is for kids and fans aged 6+.  No Way That's True is also part of a FreeTime Unlimited Subscription. Have you ever had a sudden urge to have a watermelon, but you lacked the transportation and/or funds to get to an actual store to buy and eventually taste a watermelon? You will never have this problem again! With the brand new Alexa Watermelon Store, you can experience the purchasing and consumption process of watermelons, all from the comfort of your home. Simply ask the Watermelon Store for a watermelon, and you will receive a verbal watermelon! But what kind of watermelon did you get? Was it tasty? Delicious? Sweet? Or was it moldy? Alexa will answer that for you! What are you waiting for? Go get some watermelon.

Ask Alexa "whats for snack" and she answers with randomized answers that are mostly healthy, and general enough that hopefully something should fit the pick. Examples of answers include: - a fruit or vegetable - something that grew on a tree - crackers with cheese - yogurt (most specific answer) - a protien

Crazy version of the classic Freeze Dance!  Dance in wacky ways and freeze when the music stops. If the kids are on a sugar rush or just having a crazy indoor day, open Freeze Dancers and let them go on and on and on. This game doesn't stop until the last kid drops! ***UPDATED on April 2019 with a brand new SPACE pack! While playing, try saying ALEXA, DANCE IN SPACE! *** If you like Freeze Dancers, please take the time to leave a review <3 Feedback is also always welcome at pretzel.voice@gmail.com  Check out www.pretzellabs.co for more fun skills and updates!  Happy dancing!  Music by: Ben Sound: https://www.bensound.com/ Purple Planet: http://www.purple-planet.com Audeeyah: https://audeeyah.com/free-royalty-free-music

The kids need something to do (or maybe you just need a break from the wonderful darlings).  Look no further - this skill, Animal Workout, allows kids to become different animals while getting exercise.  Animal Workout will offer up encouraging words as they go along to also boost motivation and confidence.  This skill is great for rainy days and sunny days too! When in the skill, to continue on say ‘More’ and when you’re finished say ‘All Done’. Update History: Dec 2020 - Removed in-skill purchasing and made all content free.  There is nothing purchasable and no upsells in this skill. Jun 2019 - Added expansion pack option with 55 new animals and moves including make-believe creatures, farm animals, bugs, and more May 2019 - Per user feedback, removed reference to climbing and fixed animal scrolling issue on echo spots Dec 2018 - Added voice over, sounds effects, and new music to all animals Oct 2018 - Added images for screen devices Jun 2018 - Added more animals, including a monster - rar! Voice over by Envy McKee Illustrations, including icon, by Drawkman Music from Chad Tenwick Audio, Pond 5, with introduction by FreeSFX

Get ready to dance to these fun, kid-friendly beats as you and your child explore imaginary worlds together. When the music stops, practice freezing like statues. Then, get moving again when the music starts. Your child can dance their way through the alphabet or the Amazon Rainforest, learning a little about each subject along the way. This is a great game to play after school, during playdates, at parties, on rainy days, or when your child has some extra energy and needs to move. If you enjoy Freeze Dance, please leave us a review. Thank you! Music: DLSounds and Ben Sound

Welcome to Disney Trivia! Kids and families can test their knowledge on everything Disney, from movies, to television, to music, to the Disney Parks and Resorts.  One round of trivia is available to everyone. You can unlock more rounds by purchasing the Pack of 120 Disney Trivia questions. Additional rounds are also available through Freetime Unlimited subscriptions. Copyright ©2018 Disney  Copyright ©2018 Disney/Pixar Privacy Policy:  https://privacy.thewaltdisneycompany.com/en/ Children’s Online Privacy Policy: https://privacy.thewaltdisneycompany.com/en/for-parents/childrens-online-privacy-policy/ Do Not Sell My Info: https://privacy.thewaltdisneycompany.com/en/dnsmi/ Terms of Use: https://disneytermsofuse.com/english/

skill_name: Red Riding Hood - Interactive story for kids
skill_description: *** UPDATE*** We have added support for Māori language - now you can learn and entertain at the same time! From the Twisted Tales library, Red Riding Hood is an immersive interactive story for kids that lets you – the listener – play the part of Red Riding Hood OR the Big Bad Wolf, living the stories from their point of view! Red Riding Hood is walking through the woods, taking a lovely meal to her ailing grandmother. She has been warned about the big bad wolf, but when she meets a shaggy stranger, he insists he is the big good wolf. Should she trust him? You decide. Will she survive the meeting? It’s all up to you. Currently there are two stories available. To play them, just say: “Alexa, open Red Riding Hood” or “Alexa, open Hansel & Gretel” Twisted Tales include: * Multiple choices and alternative endings * Possibility to play story from Red Riding Hood AND Big Bad Wold point of view * Professional voice acting * Immersive music * Flawless sound effects Māori version of the story was funded by Perpetual Guardian Trust New Zealand. FEEDBACK: Please leave us a review if you like our skill, or send us an email with your suggestions and what new stories would you like us to make at contact@sonnar.nz.  For more stories please visit www.sonnar.nz/twisted-tales or search for sonnar interactive in your Alexa app.
Check the combination of the traits that you want your pet to have and know the breed of pet,Alexa have in the lot!! to suggest as per your input.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

You start by selecting your cute and funny Fluffy Friend. Your goal is to take care of it and level it up. It's simple - your Fluffy Friend needs knowledge and fun to grow. Interact with it, find out what it needs, what it likes, and play along! As you explore the rich content of this kids skill with your Fluffy Friend, you gain experience points and level up your Fluffy Friend. You can do a lot already from the start: play number games, practice times tables, listen to interactive stories, play quiz games or sing nursery rhymes together, and much more! At first your Fluffy Friend can only do a few simple things, but as it levels up it becomes able to do much more and the challenges become harder and more diverse. You will want to keep coming back to play with your Fluffy Friend to keep discovering and learning new things. Don't worry if you have to leave and come back later - your Fluffy Friend will be waiting for you, ready to pick up where you left it. Take good care of your Fluffy Friend! Here are a few things to try once you open the skill and choose your Fluffy Friend: - Play a story - Play animal quiz - Play music quiz - Play some music - Practice times tables - Tell a joke - What is my score? - What can I do? This skill's content is suitable for all ages.

Play an interactive adventure-themed story with sound effects and prompts. Get ready for laughs and giggles as players fill in the blanks. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Would You Rather for Kids is a simple but addicting game where you make a choice between two lighthearted and silly situations. Will the rest of the world agree with your decision? You have to try the skill to find out! Enjoy hundreds of fun, family-friendly questions to keep all ages entertained for hours. With multiplayer mode, you can enjoy the game with your entire family or play by yourself. Play Would You Rather at a sleepover, at a party, on family game night or simply to pass time. Questions are continually added so check back often for updates. Editions include: -Standard  -Magic -Hogwarts -Animals -Superhero -Christmas Points and Leaderboard:  Earn two points for each question you play. It doesn't matter if your response matches the majority. There is one account for the family, so points for your parents, siblings count towards your account and help you climb the leaderboard faster. More reason to play with family. Remember Tuesday and Thursday are double point days. Earn 4 points for each question you play.  While playing you can access the leaderboard by saying "Alexa, show my leaderboard"  Badges: You can earn the Explorer and Expert badges for each edition. You can get an "Explorer" badge on completing the first round of an edition. You earn the "Expert" status once you play 5 rounds of the same editions. While playing you can access the badges by saying "Alexa, my badges"

No need to be sad or feel lonely ever again. This obedient dog will lighten up your mood. Make him do whatever you feel like! Unlike the real dogs, it listens to you and it won't require any food (just electricity) nor make your house messy. It helps to keep intruders away! - Try saying "Bark at him" or "Scare him away". Actions supported currently: Howling  Growling Woofing Whining  Barking Licking Scaring Biting You can say: "Alexa, launch Virtual Dog" "Alexa, Ask my dog to bark at him" "Come on, whine for me" "Bite him " "Lick her"
Your new best friend is here! Talking Lucy! Play with Lucy everyday, take care of her as your own pet. Teach her new things by talking to her everyday. Lucy will repeat everything that you say.

Alexa will read aloud to you and ask you questions about each passage. Test your listening comprehension by remembering facts and details. Answer correctly and achieve a high score. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

skill_name: Yes or No Response Decision Helper
skill_description: Gives a Random Yes or No answer

skill_name: The Zoo Game - fun animal game for kids and family
skill_description: You are the boss of Zoo Land. Your workers will come to you with 5 questions, and it's up to you to tell them what to do next. Make the right decisions and the zoo will keep running smoothly. However, make a few wrong moves and who knows what those cheeky animals will be getting up to... You will score points based on your decisions, and have your high score stored to try and beat next time. Good luck! ******************** Latest Updates: - Database of Zoo Land scenarios extended by 20%+ - Compete against other players for the daily high score! - Added helper prompt in case a child took too long or tried something other than yes/no answer - Sound effect to celebrate your good decisions! :) (daily score based on UTC time zone)

Play an interactive adventure-themed story with sound effects and prompts. Get ready for laughs and giggles as players fill in the blanks. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Oh no! A mean old wizard has stolen all the fairy tales and taken them to a secret island far away! Can you help them remember who they are to break the spell that holds them captive? Fairy Tale Island is a cute narrative quiz game for kids. Explore the island to find classic fairy tales, who have forgotten who they are. Reveal their identity by answering questions about their tale and finally calling out their name! Of course you can always get a tip, if you're stuck ;) (Icon made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com)

Alexa quizzes you on trivia topics. Provide the answer and try to achieve a high score. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Ask Alexa any of the questions that are included in the skill and she'll provide the corresponding answer. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint.  Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Every day, Lincoln Loud has to work through the chaos of his house to get anything done. But now, you can help him in The Loud House Challenge! Follow Lincoln around the house as he tries to help his sisters—Lori, Leni, Luna, Luan, Lynn, Lucy, Lana, Lola, Lisa and Lily—with all the crazy curveballs they throw at him. You’ll help Lincoln gather supplies for an epic sleepover, remake a birthday cake that fell on the floor, and get Lily to take her nap! Can you and Lincoln save the day in the Loud House? To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, open Loud House Challenge”. To quit, just say "Alexa, quit" anytime during the game. This game requires at least 1 Echo Button. Think you know more than your friends about disney films?  Challenge your friends and family to the disney trivia quiz and put your disney knowledge to the test. The player with the most correct answers wins the game! If you love this app please rate it 5 stars and leave feedback so i can continue to make fun Alexa skills!

Hello, it’s Elmo! When children ask to “Open Sesame Street,” they’ll be able to speak directly to their furry red friend. Elmo's so excited! He can’t wait to share all the fun things he knows about the letter of the day. And Elmo's always up for a good game of Hide & Seek, with silly sounds as clues to where he’s hiding. Sesame Street encourages kids to engage in imaginative play, learn new words, and just be giggly together with the voice of a familiar, fun-loving friend. We hope your preschoolers have fun playing and learning with Elmo. We’re learning all the time, too, and really welcome the input of families like yours. Try Saying Things like: “Alexa, open Sesame Street” “Alexa, ask Sesame Street to call Elmo” “Alexa, ask Sesame Street to play Hide & Seek” "Alexa, ask Sesame Street to find Elmo"

The monsters from the new movie Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation, come together in this fun kids skill. Drac’s Pack will read you a monster story or sing you a nursery rhyme with a monster twist. You can also meet members of Drac's Pack. It’s as easy as, “Alexa, tell Hotel Transylvania to sing a nursery rhyme”. Look online for secret phrases that unlock hidden monster surprises such as, “Alexa, ask Hotel Transylvania for a joke”.

Welcome to Scientist Escape the room 7 by Dr. Song.  <This is Pandemic edition!> You wake up and find yourself turned into Santa. You have to escape the room with Rudolph. You have use clues and think scientifically to handle this situation! Look around to collect clues (information), check objects that you find and Use the clues together with a simple scientific knowledge. Once you understand the clues, you carry out your brilliant way for this situation! To start, just say "Alexa, open scientist escape the room 7" <Contact info: If you have any question or suggestion, please leave comments.> <About this version> This game is free to play now. <How to play> If you want to look around to collect clues, Say "Look forward" or "Look right". (Forward, up, down, right, and left) If you find something and get more information(clue) from an object found, Say, for example, "Check the door". If you want to use an object you found on the other object, Say, for example, "Use the red key on the bathtub".  If you want to listen to the instruction again, Say, "Help me". If you need a hint, Say, "Give me a hint". If you need more time, Say "More time". You can leave, stop, quit the game anytime by saying "Stop" or "Quit".

skill_name: Hansel and Gretel - Interactive Story for kids
skill_description: From the Twisted Tales library, Hansel & Gretel is an immersive interactive story for kids that lets you – the listener – play the part of Hansel & Gretel OR the Evil Witch, living the stories from their point of view! Hansel and Gretel have a problem. The narrator of their story is really boring. So they tell him to get on with it! He is rather perturbed by this, characters aren’t supposed to talk back. Will they resolve their differences? Who really controls the story? What are the possible effects of eating too much gingerbread? And should they visit the incredibly big, ugly, evil ogre who eats children? It’s all up to you. Did you know there is another story called Red Riding Hood? To find out more check your Alexa app and look for Sonnar. Twisted Tales include: * Multiple choices and alternative endings * Possibility to play story from Hansel & Gretel and Evil Witch point of view * Professional voice acting * Immersive music * Flawless sound effects FEEDBACK: Please leave us a review if you like our skill. For more stories please visit search for sonnar interactive in your Alexa app.

A fun game to teach different words like names of fruits, vegetables, animals, colors, days, months, planets etc to toddlers during the early development stage. Helps with memory and kills boredom. Just start the skill, listen to the category and reply with a name. You can skip by saying 'Next' or repeat the old one by saying 'Previous' or repeat the existing one by saying 'Repeat'. To terminate and exit the game, say 'Stop'.

This is Alexa's premiere Hide and Seek experience, where you get to hide, and Alexa tries to find you. Pick your best hiding spot in the same room as your Alexa device, and remember to speak loudly so  she can hear you. If she can't guess where you are after three tries, then you win! If there are any additional hiding spots that you would like added to this skill, please leave a review and let me know so that I may add them. Thank you, and enjoy!

Musical Chairs, Freeze Dancers, Musical Bumps and More! Bored? This compendium of active and super fun family games will keep everyone entertained for hours. Dance and sing to catchy tunes and throw your best shapes. Go on, go crazy!  Musical games currently available include: Musical Chairs (Trip to Jerusalem) Freeze Dancers (Musical Statues) Musical Bumps (We All Fall Down) Games coming soon include: Animal Dancers If You're Happy and You Know It Copy Clap Name the Instrument Spin The Microphone Dizzy Dancers Musical Clothes Hot Potato Pass The Parcel Ring Around The Rosie Dance, hop, clap, walk, crawl, jump, sing and shout to lots of different music tracks.  If you love Musical Games, please let us know! Feedback is always welcome at hello@topvoiceapps.com

Play "The floor is lava" with Alexa. It is played by people of all ages, in which the players imagine that the floor or ground is made of lava. Have fun. Hurry up, find a save place! "The floor is lava", the game for young and old. Now Alexa challenges you. Can you save yourself from the lava? One two three four five! Did you win against the lava! Fun for the whole family.

You’re invited to the Barbie: You Can Be Anything Game! Speak to Barbie and explore her many careers on Alexa. Help animals at the Pet Vet Clinic, go on outer space missions as an Astronaut, and make goals as a Soccer player. Barbie is always eager to meet new friends and she can’t wait to hear from you. Just say, “Alexa, open Barbie” to start. You can subscribe to Barbie Plus to unlock the full game*. Barbie Plus Members can play more careers, more sports, and more activities with even more releasing every month.  Barbie Plus is also available as part of FreeTime Unlimited.   ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Barbie: You Can Be Anything skill is for kids and fans aged 6+. Ask Alexa any of the questions that are included in the skill and she'll provide the corresponding answers. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Are you a big fan of the PAW Patrol pups? Play this fun daily quiz about PAW Patrol. ****** Premium product available for purchase: • Unlimited games pack - one time purchase Lets you play as many games each day as you want. Without the pack there's a one game per day limit. ****** I'll ask you five multiple choice questions. If you think the answer to a question is option two, then wake Alexa and say "two". When you answer you must say "Alexa" first, otherwise I won't hear you ! **** Commands to use when playing **** • "I don't know"/"Next"/"Skip"  - If you don't know the answer, some of the questions are quite tricky! • "Repeat" - If you want to hear the question again, only one repeat per question though. We hope you enjoy playing the quiz as much as we enjoyed making it.
Have Lego's, Mickey Mouse Peppa Pig, Stuffed Animals, or Smurf Toys? Figure which one to play with first, Just Say, "Alexa, Open Toy Select" and Alexa will pick for you

skill_name: Blue's Clues & You! Listen and Play
skill_description: With the “Blue’s Clues & You! Listen and Play” Alexa skill from Nickelodeon, your preschooler can play with Josh and Blue in a whole new way! Listen along and help Josh figure out Blue’s clues! As kids play, they’ll use their imagination and practice skills like listening and critical thinking. With ten different storylines, there’s a new adventure every time you play, featuring friends like Magenta, Tickety Tock, Shovel and Pail, and more.    To enable the skill, simply say "Alexa, open Blue’s Clues”.*   To quit, just say "Alexa, quit" anytime during the game.   The “Blue’s Clues and You! Listen and Play” skill is for kids aged 4+ and their families. You can watch episodes of “Blue’s Clues & You!” on Nickelodeon. For issues, questions, or comments please email us at amazonalexa@nick.com.  We want to hear directly from you! *If you set up a child profile through FreeTime please enable the skill first on your account by clicking enable on the store page. Then please go to the parent dashboard and add the Blue’s Clues skill to your child’s content. You can find the dashboard by going to https://parents.amazon.com/ click your kids’ profile and then the settings cog on the right, click add content, click Alexa skills, and slide the toggle to on for Blue’s Clues and You! Listen and Play. If you never gave parental consent you will hear Alexa say “To use Blue's Clues and You Listen and Play a parent needs to give permission. I sent some information to the home screen of your Alexa app." Please open your Alexa app and make sure you are logged into the account that’s on your assistant device. On the home screen of the app you will see a notification that you can tap. It will open the store page of the skill. Tap launch, which will bring you to the parental consent form. Click through the prompts and once you allow parental consent you can access the skill. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The Blue's Cues & You! Listen and Play Alexa Skill collects personal user data as well as non-personal user data (including aggregated data). User data collection is in accordance with applicable law, such as COPPA. skill_name: Hangman Game - with display for Echo Show
skill_description: The classic hangman game with display. You may pick a category upon start or simply say "Start" to pick a random category. Guess the word by saying letters (e.g. "A"). If your Alexa device doesn't have a screen, you may still check your hangman progress by saying "Progress". When the game ends, you may check the definition of the word by saying "Dictionary".

Po, the Dragon Warrior, and Master Shifu need YOU to help defeat some of the most dreaded villains in China. But first, you will need to train with the Dragon Warrior himself. Learn the six styles of kung fu—Mantis, Monkey, Viper, Crane, Tiger, and even the rarest of them all: Panda. Your kung fu fighting skills will determine whether China will be saved.

skill_name: Ella the Jellyfish: For LGS Families
skill_description: Ella the Jellyfish is a friend to all—especially to families affected by Lennox-Gastaut syndrome (LGS). By saying “Alexa, open Ella the Jellyfish,” you and your family will be able to start interacting with Ella, who can’t wait to play! Join Ella and her underwater friends for several different games and listening activities, each designed specifically with LGS families in mind. If you and your child would like to play along with Ella and her friends, you can play Ella Says, Freeze Dance, or Color Hunt. These games may involve some physical activity. If you’d like to listen, Ella can tell stories, guide you through meditations, or sing you songs! Below are some examples of the phrases you and your family can use to start playing with Ella the Jellyfish: OPEN ELLA “Alexa, open Ella the Jellyfish” “Alexa, start Ella the Jellyfish” “Alexa, play Ella the Jellyfish” Once you have opened Ella, below are the different ways you can interact with her: PLAY WITH ELLA “Alexa, play Ella Says” “Alexa, play Freeze Dance” “Alexa, play Color Hunt” LISTEN TO ELLA “Alexa, listen to a story” “Alexa, listen to a long story” “Alexa, listen to a short story” “Alexa, listen to a meditation” “Alexa, listen to a short meditation” “Alexa, listen to a long meditation” “Alexa, listen to a song” “Alexa, listen to The Alphabet Song” “Alexa, listen to Pat-a-Cake” “Alexa, listen to Skip to My Lou” The content in this skill is provided for informational and educational purposes only.

Teach your kids basic math, by using this skill. They are taught basic addition and subtraction. The children or even adults using this skill are encouraged to do mental addition and subtraction. The skill offer three difficulty levels and thoroughly exercises your brain. Happy Addiing... or Subtracting!!!

Welcome to Trivial Pursuit Family Edition by Hasbro, the game where kids and grown-ups get to test their trivia knowledge together. Compete with friends to answer questions from one of six different categories. A correct answer allows you to try to answer an additional bonus question. Win the game by correctly answering one question each from all six categories and a final challenge question! Say 'Alexa, help' if you ever get lost. If you'd like to start over, you can say 'Alexa, start over.' If you didn't catch something, you can say 'Alexa, repeat.'

Works with screen devices like the Echo Show where you can see beautiful pictures of all your travel adventures.  Also, double the questions for each country means you can explore countries multiple times.  Earn gold doubloons and tickets to play our exciting new mini-game called "Who, What, Where?" with each country you travel through. SPECIAL: Use the doubloons you earn to take part in our limited-edition events and make sure you earn enough to grab each of our collectible characters unique to Travel Quest.  The Samurai Warrior, Cleopatra, Athena, and the Roman Gladiator are now available with more characters coming soon. Designed for kids 13 and under, yet fun for adults, too. This skill is an adventure-styled travel exploration game.  A unique passport is created for each member of the household that wants to play.  Once you have a passport, you are given a choice of countries to explore. Exploring a country allows you to learn about the cuisine, geography, landmarks, leaders, events, festivals and even more in a fun way. Answering simple questions allows you to explore the country further.  When you finish exploring a country, you get gold doubloons, a ticket to play our bonus game, "Who, What Where?", and a chance of leveling up. Current countries include: Japan, Canada, France, Brazil, Egypt, Australia, Guatemala, Italy, Greece, Tunisia and Turkey.  Iceland and other countries coming soon!  Give us feedback and let us know which countries and special events you want next.  Also, if you had fun and learned, please consider giving us a review!

Very simple and extremely compelling math puzzle game. For kids especially, it  helps with additions, subtractions and divisions. It is a variant of the famous 21 game. The game starts with you counting numbers starting from 1 followed by your opponent Alexa continuing where you left off. Each can say up to 3 numbers at a time and gets turn one after other. Whoever says 17 loses the game. So plan your strategy accordingly. Once you win some games, the difficulty starts to increase. You'll then need to be quick and smart in using your mathematical skills to continue winning. -You can say "help" at any point to know what numbers you have to say and find what the target is -You can also say "increase Difficulty" or "Decrease difficulty" make it harder or easier -You can say "restart game" or "start a new game" to start over again -You can also say Alexa, ask Number Ladder start a new game with 27 and 5 for higher difficulty and custom target

Testing your memory regularly is a great way to keep your mind sharp.  This skill is an amazing tool for children and adults alike.  The review portion will give you 3 sets of letters with words that correspond to the letter.  Once you have comfortably gone through the entire review you can test your skill by taking the test that will go through the entire alphabet and the corresponding words that you learned for the week.  When you are in the review portion of the program please say "OK" between every 3 sets of letter to continue learning.  When your done after a 3 letter spread say "NO" or "STOP" or you can say "TAKE TEST" if your ready to test your self for the week.  It is usually good to do a wednesday test after using the program for the first 2 days of the week and then do a final test on friday to see the progess you have made.  You can play this with your child and you can help them new words and you can test your memeory as well.

What if someone's there for parents, to suggest a game idea to try and play with kids during travel or while with a bunch of friends?? Of Course, There's is one!! Just say,  Alexa, Play "Craze On the Go" Give it a try and break the boring road trips or kid's play-dates! The main objective behind Craze On the Go is to help parents and make journeys with less screen time, more listening, playing and enhancing kids brain time!  Encourages Communication, Interaction, Creativity, Memory, Gross and Fine motor skills, Actions, Team Work and Fun Learning! Do you love traveling?? It's Yes for most!  But how about, Travel with Kids??  For some parents, travel can be overwhelming while managing kids all way long; Same way kids too lose their patience when they have to sit for a longer time and in turn the travel become boring!  Kids are part of our life; so are the long trips!  The Best Thing about Parenting is to find the best possible solution that works for your family!! One of such solution coined by a Mom of Two with an intention towards making long road trips fun as well as educational. In other words, Long trips offers us Longer together time means Longer yet Creative ways to develop and ignite Kids Brain! Finally started working on a solution and creating a curated list of games that works with kids in real time, and let Alexa suggest you a game idea to try via Craze on the Go! Proudly presenting, "Craze On the go!", a curated collection of ideas, the real game ideas to try, play and have fun!  Each and every idea has been individually coined keeping kid's growing mindset in top priority and focusing on both fun as well as educational games. Though the ideas were curated as if it's fun while traveling. But you will soon realize not only in travel, most of the ideas like silly ideas, creative or instead of games would be apt and start working for your family when you are with kids or friends or party time or play-dates or after school and looking for some fun and educational games to try and play.  So many game ideas can also used by teachers or caretakers for making a random pick for organizing some indoor activities or games time. Just try Craze On the Go by,  # Enabling the Skill, "Craze On the Go!" in your Echo Devices. # Just Say... Alexa, Play Craze On The Go! # Listen to ideas, try, play and have fun!! # Once skill is enabled you could able to listen ideas in all of your Echo Devices. # If you missed hearing a part of game idea or have some doubts in game rules, any of the passengers can just check Amazon Alexa app and toggle to Activity for a simple card with description! # While traveling, if you are don't have your Alexa device in car, Open the Alexa App from your mobile, then tap the Alexa Icon and Say "Craze On the Go". That's it, Start Listening to all the ideas from your already purchased or available catalog! Right Now, Craze On the Go is a blend of game ideas in 3 categories such as  Family - game ideas helping families work together, have fun and spending quality time. Silly - silly game ideas; If kids go silly and have fun then of course its fun for all. Creative - game ideas which enhances your creativity! Kindly leave your ratings and reviews which would be helpful in shaping "Craze On the Go!" Would love to hear which games worked for your family or any suggestions or ideas you would like Craze On the Go can add to it's growing catalog of game ideas!

Welcome to Music Bop Adventures! This Alexa Kids Skill features fun, interactive adventures that encourages movement whilst also incorporating educational themes. There are currently 4 adventures to explore with more adventures available: 1. Space – Hop into a spaceship and zoom into outer space; dance and sing along to the names of the planets in a fun song. 2. Under the Sea - Hop into a submarine and explore the wonders of the sea; bump into various sea creatures, tackle obstacles and sing along with a featured friend. 3. Jungle – Hop into a super jet and explore the wonders of the jungle; swim across the river, avoid wild animals and sing along with a featured friend. 4. Weather - Hop into a super jet and tinker with a weather machine; tackle the different weather types as they come. ----------------------------- GOLD SUBSCRIPTION ----------------------------- 5. Sky Adventure 6. Cave Adventure 7. North Pole Adventure 8. Dinosaur Adventure 9. Pirate Adventure Each adventure begins with the same theme tune. To begin the adventures, please use any of the following Alexa commands: “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play adventures” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to shuffle adventures” To play one specific adventure, please use any of the following Alexa commands: “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Space adventure” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Under the Sea adventure” “Alexa, ask Music Bop to play Jungle Adventure”

Take development and roleplay to a whole new level of fun with the free LEGO® DUPLO® Stories on Alexa! Whether your toddler is the captain of a fishing boat or a bird travelling far and wide, they will experience the joy of learning with LEGO® DUPLO® through short, interactive stories involving animal play and vehicle play - using their very own DUPLO® bricks! And don’t worry if your child does not have all of the pieces – they can use whatever they have on hand to act the story. The only limits are their creativity and imagination!  LEGO® DUPLO® Stories encourage children to learn via creative play in a fun, safe atmosphere. Learning numbers and colors and developing language skills have never been more enjoyable!  Interaction is easy!  Go to the settings in your Alexa app and turn on Child Directed Skills  To start, say "Alexa, open LEGO DUPLO Stories”.  To select animal stories, say “Animal story”  To select vehicle stories, say “Vehicle story”.  To play the animal or vehicle story again, say “Yes” at the end of the story.  To quit the animal or vehicle story, say "Alexa, exit" anytime during the story.  To learn more about LEGO® DUPLO® learning games and story starters, visit LEGO.com/DUPLO – and experience the joy of creative learning through development and roleplay!  The animals featured in this Skill include:  Bird  Cat  Cow  Dog  Rabbit  The vehicles featured in this Skill include:  Boat  Car  Plane  Train  Truck

While her Abuelita is at work as a doctor at the hospital, Olivia and her dog, Bruno, take care of the home, treating patients like Fuzzy the Teddy Bear, Rubber Ducky, and Frisky, Olivia’s pet hamster.  From anxiety to coughing and tummy aches, this adventure is full of songs that teach you how to be a good doctor and help your friends feel better. - Wash Your Hands - Cover Your Face - You Got a Boo Boo - 4-7-8 Breathing - Sometimes My Tummy Feels Funny Help a vibrant cast of characters feel better in this fully-voiced musical adventure – but make sure you wash your hands first! This skill is for informational and educational purposes only, and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, treatment or diagnosis. Call your doctor to receive medical advice. If you think you may have a medical emergency, please dial your local emergency response phone number.

Mathcaster is an exciting combination of education and entertainment, suitable for ages between 8-12. This Alexa Skill is a perfect resource to help children improve and develop their math skills in a fun, exciting and challenging way. In this game, you will meet a baby llama named Maria that loves her llama mama.  Maria will ask you to guess how many mama llamas showed up in your backyard. You can guess between 0 and 100 mamas.  You will continue to guess higher or lower until you get it correct!  How fast can you guess it?   There are fun llama sounds build into the game.  The game is fun for all ages, especially if you like animals!!

KIDS CARTOON QUIZ is a simple quiz skill created specifically for kids, including the younger ones.  ⭐GAMEPLAY⭐ During the game, Alexa will ask you questions about some of the most popular children cartoon series from recent years, and give you four choices of answers. All you have to do is respond by choosing Answer 1, 2, 3 or 4. You can also say the actual answer, in which case Alexa will ask you to confirm your answer just to be sure she heard you correctly! ⭐COMMANDS⭐ The following commands are available during the game: - WAIT, for Alexa to play you a music while you take time to think about the answer. To talk to Alexa before the end of the music, just say the name of the device, e.g. Alexa, Echo, or any other name you have set for your Alexa device. - REPEAT, to hear the question and choices of answer again. You can also ask Alexa to repeat only the question, or just the options. - HELP, to get a reminder on how the game is played, as well as the commands available. ⭐NOTE TO PARENTS/CARERS⭐ Kids Cartoon Quiz was built specifically for children and as such, the content is adapted to a younger audience. For example, you won't find any question about who created a cartoon show, or the date it first aired on TV! The language and interaction was also kept as simple as possible so that children can play the game on their own. Enjoy!

Are you a big fan of Hey Duggee? Play this fun daily quiz and test your knowledge of Duggee and the squirrels. ****** NEW ****** Premium product now available for purchase: • Unlimited games pack - one time purchase Lets you play as many games each day as you want. Without the pack there's a one game per day limit. ****** I'll ask you five multiple choice questions. If you think the answer to a question is option two, then say "Alexa, two". When you answer you must say "Alexa" first, otherwise I won't hear you ! **** Commands to use when playing **** • "I don't know"/"Next"/"Skip"  - If you don't know the answer, some of the questions are quite tricky! • "Repeat" - If you want to hear the question again, only one repeat per question though! We hope you enjoy playing the quiz as much as we enjoyed making it. This skill is an independent creation and is not produced by, or endorsed by, Studio AKA or the BBC. Hey Duggee (word mark and character logos) are trade marks of Studio AKA Limited. Duggee audio content © Studio AKA Limited.
Jack and the Beanstalk is an English fairy tale written in 1734.  This skill allows you to be part of the story.  Just provide your first name and gender and you become part of the story.

Need to find the droids you're looking for but can't speak alien languages? Look no further. With help from C-3PO and SD-89, you'll learn key phrases in Shyriiwook and Droidspeak, and more. When you're ready, break out your best growls, roars, and beeps as you speak with Chewbacca, R2-D2, BB-8, and more in their own languages. Just watch what you say, or you may become bantha fodder! Star Wars: C-3PO Translates! includes phrases and conversations in Shyriiwook and Droidspeak, featuring C-3PO, Chewbacca, R2-D2, BB-8 and more. Ewokese, the language of the Ewoks, plus many more phrases and conversations in Shyriiwook and Droidspeak, are available through Amazon Kids+ subscriptions. Copyright © & TM Lucasfilm Ltd. Note: This game requires an Echo device with a display, preferably an Echo Show, to display pictures and to support touch. The ideal entertaining pastime for everyone, young or old, who wants to put their memory to the test! After you have chosen a difficulty level, you will be shown different pictures to remember and when you are ready, Alexa will ask you a question about the previous pictures! For example, a new picture has been added or an existing one is hidden behind a question mark... Besides 3 levels of difficulty, there is also the new "Infinity Mode" as an exiting premium content, which has no fixed number of rounds, gets more and more difficult, and only ends when you have made two mistakes.  Additionally, this new mode also includes a high score with which you can challenge yourself or your friends and family! We would be very happy if you could take the time to rate this skill.

Roll out the red carpet and get ready to shine in the spotlight in Disney's Frozen Sing! Take to the stage and sing before a crowd of Frozen fans. You'll have two ways to sing: When you're in "in rehearsal", you'll be guided through a performance as you learn the words to a song and find your true royal voice. And when you're "in the spotlight", you'll sing on your own with the song's vocals set at a volume you prefer. So bring your microphone, your crown, and that awesome voice of yours and get ready to be the star you always knew you were. Frozen Sing includes the Disney Frozen song "For the First Time in Forever". More songs from Disney's Frozen and Disney's Frozen 2 are available in Frozen Sing through Amazon Kids+ subscriptions. Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Note: This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your child's requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

Take your children on an adventure with Let's Play: You Decide, a series of fun, interactive and educational activities led by Rebecca and Sid from the hit kids TV show Let's Play, a CBeebies favourite. Encourage your little ones to move their bodies, improve their listening skills and teach them the importance of helping those in need.  In the Emergency Pack, step into the shoes of a Key Emergency Workers. Help Dr. Rebecca get patients back to good health in the hospital and learn about the sound of the heartbeat. Next, lend the Fire Department a helping hand in preparing a fire truck so that it's ready for action - and then help Rebecca and the Chief Fire Officer put out a small fire in a nearby building. Finally, take on the role of a Police Officer helping Officer Sid find a lost cat.  There are three game packs available: the Emergency Pack; the History Pack; and the Explorer Pack. Each game pack features three exciting stories to immerse yourself and the kids in. The emergency pack is **free** to play. The other two game packs: History and Explorer are available through In-Skill Purchasing. Enable notifications from this skill to get alerted when new game packs are available! **Disclaimer** - NOTE TO PARENTS  This Let’s Play game is intended for kids to have fun and learn. However, this app may only be downloaded, or any extras purchased, by a parent or guardian. Whilst we hope kids will have fun whilst using our product, we do not expect too much crashing and bumping needed whilst being used.  We cannot be held responsible for any direct, indirect, punitive, incidental, special consequential damages, to property or life, whatsoever arising out of or connected with the use or misuse or our product. Remember to play safe and we would always recommend having a parent or guardian present! This tool does not provide medical advice, and is for informational and educational purposes only, and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, treatment or diagnosis. Call your doctor to receive medical advice. If you think you may have a medical emergency, please dial your local emergency response phone number.

Waka Waka! Talk to PAC-MAN in his own language and help him chomp his way through spectacular mazes, escaping ghosts and eating delicious fruit along the way. Meet PAL, the PAC-Assistant and Liaison, who helps out PAC-denizens in their day to day lives... just like Alexa does for you! But the Ghosts have stolen PAL’s voice powers! You and PAC-MAN need to help him recover them in this electrifying new adventure! Each power will be in a voice assistant-themed world. Can you find them all? Features: - Speak Wakanese with PAC-MAN – Say “waka”, “wiki”, “wika” and “waki” to tell PAC-MAN which way he should go! - Explore wondrous and different Worlds, each with 15 mazes for you to help PAC-MAN complete. New Worlds are added in every regular content update! - Experience classic arcade action with Inky, Pinky, Blinky and Clyde – all with a new voice-controlled twist. - Collect classic Power Pellets and discover the new Frenzy Mode, along with all the new mechanics each World has to reveal. - Complete objectives to earn stars and stack up an epic high score on each level! - Built by Doppio, the leading voice game developer founded by gaming veterans, makers of voice game hits The Vortex and The 3% Challenge. - NEW! Kick it off in Sports World, the latest PAL function, with 15 new levels. Steal all bases to reach the Max Score and kick soccer balls around the maze to defeat any Ghosts in your path! If you like this game, please leave us a review on the Alexa Skills Store. We love reviews! If you need assistance with PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA, or have any feedback about the game, please get in touch at https://doppio.games/support ******* AUDIO-ONLY EXPERIENCE: You can play the full version of PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA on an Echo Show or a Fire TV Cube device. If you don’t currently have one of these devices, don’t fret! You can still enjoy the PAC-MAN experience through the audio-only experience. Have insightful and fun conversations with PAC-MAN about anything. Ask him about his birthday, request a beatbox, and listen for the moods that PAC-MAN may be in. Try out all kinds of interactions with this classic arcade character! PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA & ©2021 BANDAI NAMCO Entertainment Inc. Published by BANDAI NAMCO Entertainment America Inc. ************** Update History ************** We update PAC-MAN™ WAKA WAKA regularly! For a full list of updates, visit us online at https://doppio.games/waka ************** In-Skill Purchases ************** Access to all of the content in PAC-MAN Waka Waka requires a subscription to the Waka Club. Waka Club members have full access to all available Worlds, and will get access to new Worlds as they are released. Without a subscription, you can enjoy the five levels of Tutorial World, as well as the first level in each other World, free of charge.

Imagination meets innovation with the KidKraft 2-in-1 Kitchen & Market skill for Amazon Alexa (parental consent required). On one side, kids can learn to shop in the market with self-checkout, working smart scanner, bagging area, cash and drawer, storage shelves and freezer. On the other side, kids can cook in the lights and sounds kitchen, which includes fridge, freezer, sink, smart faucet, smart stovetop, smart oven, smart cutting board, microwave, storage hooks, chalkboard sign, storage shelves, utensils, plates, smart pot and pan. There are 34 interactive food items plus pot and pan that interact with the stove, cutting board and checkout scanner through built-in sensors. With 360˚ play for multiple kids and realistic kitchen and market sounds, the fun is magical, inspirational and unlike anything seen before. Once enabled, the KidKraft skill for Alexa will only respond when one of the RFID sensors are triggered in the kitchen or market. This skill will also respond to other inputs such as the stove/oven, faucet, oven door, game buttons and recipe cards.

skill_name: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs: Foodimals
skill_description: Welcome to the world of Sony Pictures Animation's Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs! Inventor Flint Lockwood’s food-generating machine has gone haywire creating new animals made of food! These new “Foodimal” pets need your help and support. Welcome to Maths Monsters Island.  This mysterious Island is home the the Maths Monsters. Rumour has it that there is buried treasure here on the Island and the Maths Monsters protect it and that they will do anything to stop people getting their hands on it. The only way to find and keep the treasure is by answering times tables questions to distract the Maths Monsters for long enough not to notice what you are doing. Maths Monsters is great for children to learn the times tables whilst having fun and competing to reach the top of the leaderboard. We have partnered up with select schools to allow them to see the results anonymously which will allow them to help children in the classroom by working on areas of the times table where a bit more practice is required. If your child's school has given you a pass phrase, you can use it when prompted by the skill or by saying my pass phrase is, followed by your pass phrase. We would like to thank Leamington Primary Academy for partnering up with us to make this skill. v1.0

To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Your requests to this skill are not shared with the skill developer.

With the Number Pirates children at pre-school and primary level can playfully learn the numbers from 1 to 10. The player is on a sea voyage and travels from island to island getting to know the numbers and their written form. At the end of each island the player experiences an adventure with Peter the pirate. Step by step the children learn three numbers on each island and is practicing them in short and fun games. Overall there are many hours of learning fun waiting for the kids. The learning is realized absolutely child-friendly and children can handle the skill completely on their own. Due to the varied mini games the adventure stays exciting the whole time. Whenever the kids need a break the skill will remember their progress, so they can continue right where they stopped. It is also possible for several kids to learn with one Alexa, since every kid will save their own progress. Each island belongs to one animal. When you are on an island you can either learn or practice the numbers for example: - „Panda learn“ - „Panda practice one“ Possible answers in the games are: - „yes“, „no“ - „one“, „two“, „three“, „four“, „five“, „six“, „seven“, „eight“, „nine“, „ten“ - „left“, „right“, „middle“ - „wrong“, „right“ Features: - Over 50 mini games - Many hours of gameplay fun without repetition - Exciting pirate adventure - Child-friendly introduction in the world of numbers - Progress will be saved - Different progress for several children is possible - Visual and auditory arranging of the numbers Currently Number Pirates is only available for the Echo Show first and second generation and for the FireTV

skill_name: Jungle Book Indian Song and Stories - Unofficial
skill_description: Now you can listen to the song and stories on Alexa by saying, Alexa, open jungle book song. (Unofficial) The Alexa skill plays the song in the Hindi language. Usage of the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, open jungle book song Alexa: Starting Jungle Stories- <audio> - You can say, begin, to begin. User: begin Alexa: This is Episode <number> <Alexa completes the story or user interruption> User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, open jungle book song Alexa: <audio> You were listening to Episode <number>, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to the first episode and you can ask Alexa to step forward by saying Alexa, next> You are listening to the Jungle stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the Jungle stories. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This “Jungle Book Indian Song and Stories - Unofficial” Alexa skill is intended for fun and entertainment purposes only. It contains audios in Indian local language ‘Hindi’. Users of this skill are fully aware of the local language and accepted to play the stories with their own knowledge and experience.
Epic Truth and Dare game to play when with friends, family, or loved ones.

Are you ready to explore your emotions? DJ Missy Motion is in the house to help kids celebrate their feelings.  Join in DJ Missy’s Dance Party, Name That Mood guessing game, and Feelings Facts trivia and earn rewards. Then, power down in The Chill Zone. MOOD MAGIC is a first-of-its-kind Alexa skill that teaches kids ages 5 to 8 about their emotions (and improves moods!) using original songs and feelings-focused activities. It’s part dance party, part mindful play, and a whole lot of fun. DJ Missy teaches self-awareness and the powerful idea that we can control our emotions—and even change and enjoy them—with music.  Developed with a respected child psychologist, MOOD MAGIC also lets kids know it’s okay to have feelings and gives them the words and tools to better express themselves. Everyone gets [angry/afraid/etc.] sometimes! Whether kids need to “shake the sillies out” or go from “blue to happy,” DJ Missy will find a song or activity to match the emotion.  ** Make sure ‘Kid Skill Purchasing’ is enabled in your Alexa app to purchase the expanded experience with bonus songs, Feelings Facts, Chill Zone activities, and reward sounds. ** If you enjoyed MOOD MAGIC please leave us a review below! We'd also love to hear from you at hello@boomintegrated.com. Thanks for playing and dancing with us!  —DJ Missy Motion. Please Note: Disabling the skill will erase all previous player data on the game. All songs written and produced by John Marshall Media Vocals performed by Aspen Vincent, Bryce Ryness and Jeff Washburn DJ performed by Kara Oates Illustrations by Helen Haggerty Mood Magic™ is © 2020 BOOM Integrated, a division of John Marshall Media. All rights reserved.

Learn the colors in a playful way with the help of Alexa. As a prerequisite to play you need at least two echo buttons OR an Alexa device with display. Before the game starts the echo buttons need to be registered for the game by clicking on it. Difficulty increases with the number of registered buttons. The game principle is easy. Alexa asks for a color and shows the registered buttons or the virtual buttons on the screen in different colors where only one is the correct one. The following In-Skill products are available for purchase to extend the game with additional colors: - Color Package 1: violet, orange, white, turquoise - Color Package 2: pink, lime, gold, lavender, coral The game continues to run until it is stopped with the voice command "Alexa, stop". Note: ======== Echo Buttons are not supported on FireTV Stick. The colors are chosen directly on the screen with the help of the remote control. If there are any problems, crashes or questions send a feedback to the developer! Available voice commands: ============================================== * Alexa, start learning colors * Alexa, start learning colors and play on screen * Alexa, start learning colors and play without buttons

Santa needs your help to save Christmas. Santa has been busy leaving gifts around the world. But the naughty elves dropped presents off his sleigh and he can't remember where!    Listen to the elves' journey and see if you can remember: • Where the presents have been hidden? • What colour the presents were? • How many presents were left? Will you be able to remember where all the presents have been left and save Christmas? Features: • Random locations and presents means no two adventures are the same • Funny and surprising sound effects • Cute graphics for screen devices • Score saving Please leave a review for this game. Would you like to create a story about a space alien inventor who crash lands on an island full of pirates?  A space alien whose best friend is a cowgirl, and goes on an epic quest against a stinky hobgoblin?  Or, how about a pixie princess who goes on a crazy space adventure with a parrot who thinks he's a human?  What about a law abiding sheriff (coming soon) who has his favourite hat stolen by a pirate queen and goes after her in a rocket? Then it's time to MASH UP! Choose your favourite hero. Pair them up with a sidekick. Decide where will your story begin. Best of all... chose a dastardly villain. Mwah! Mwah ha haaa! .... and lots more ways to mash up your story any way you like. You can mix and mash from very different story universes to create thousands of epic tales. No two are exactly the same. And as your story unfolds you're asked memory questions and make decisions for your hero. Whatever you say will change the outcome of each Mash Up even further. Will your ending be happy or not so happy? It's up to you. There are so many stories, twists and hidden surprises to unlock and discover. You'll never run out of new adventures. If your Alexa device has a screen you can enjoy rich visuals. Mash Up Adventures features lots of humor and fun, but it also has educational value too. As they enjoy each crazy tale, kids learn the components of what makes a story a story! This skill supports learning for kids in the area of English Language Arts (ELA). Say 'help' if you're not sure what is going on. If you'd like to start over, you can say 'Alexa, start over.'

This skill dictates graphic dictations. There are several dictations in the skill, whose difficulty will increase as the user makes more dictations. Dictation speed can be changed (there are five speed levels, the game is default to the medium one). Dictations are told trace by trace so the user can guess what they are drawing as the dictation goes on. Traces are referred to the cardinal points (north, south, east and west). This way, kids get used to managing with cardinal points. A piece of graph/plotting paper is needed to draw following the squares on the paper. If the user gets lost, they may say so and the dictation will start again from the beginning. Have fun drawing this dictations!

Join Mouse in the deep dark wood with this immersive and interactive voice game. Ask Alexa, "open Gruffalo Move" and enter the magical world of Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler's much loved characters. Based on the award winning animation by Magic Light Pictures, you can explore sound and music as you meet a new animal day by day. Tip-toe like Fox, "Toowhit toowhoo" with Owl and slither with Snake to complete all the activities and unlock the soothing sleep sounds in time to say goodnight to your little Gruffalo.

The fun animal guessing game for kids of all ages!  Developed by Speech professionals to promote a variety of speech and communication skills! Alexa will pretend to be an animal and it's your job to guess who she is pretending to be! All the Animal guessing games consist of: * A Fun rhyming Riddle * Creative Clues * Fun facts about the animal Alexa was pretending to be! If you have a compatible device, Alexa will show some stunning photography of the animals and the habitats they reside in. The game has been developed in partnership with a certified Speech and Language Therapist.  Particular effort has been made to promote key areas of communication development. * Listening - The riddles rhyme so as to be engaging for ears young and old. * Memory - To recall earlier clues and combine with later ones and deduce the animal. * Turn Taking - Alexa models the key process of speaking in turn before giving the player a chance to guess. * Building Vocabulary - Uses a variety of language to deepen the semantic knowledge of words. * Clear Speech - Alexa accepts common mispronunciations of animals (ie 'munti' for 'monkey') and models the correct pronunciation. * Visual Association - On Echo devices with screens, the skill associates the word with engaging pictures. * Positive Reinforcement - Alexa encourages the player positively, there is no score keeping and no penalty for incorrect answers. * Repetition - The format doesn't change, so each of the above is positively reinforced with each new play. If you are enjoying the game, leave us a review! Terms ------- All effort has been made to ensure the animal facts are accurate at the time of writing.  Please let us know if we've got something not quite right! Privacy Policy ---------------- This skill only stores the number of times you have heard an animal clue.  This is to reduce the chance of hearing the same one in succession. It contains no ads, does not communicate outside the Amazon Web Services ecosystem and uses no other personal data.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. Welcome to the Sudoku game skill. This skill offers you 4 levels of difficulty suitable for everyone. Also, you get 5 different themes.  To open the game say "open sudoku game" To play the game say "play", to set a number in the grid cell of sudoku board say "put 5 at i8"(this will set 5 at the ith row and 8th column) To check if the Sudoku is correct or wrong, say "check" You can also say 'leaderboard' to view the leaderboard(Leaderboard is currently not available and will be visible once sufficient users are available) Points according to difficulty: 5 points in Easy level 15 points in Normal level 25 points in Hard level 50 points in Challenging level The main screen shows your Overall points, level-wise points are shown on play screens for each level. You will also get 10 points for playing the game daily, 50 points for playing 5 games each day. To provide feedback/suggestions send an email on deepakrai1508@gmail.com

It's the classic game What's the time Mr Wolf. You probably already know how to play this game but if you don't keep on reading... HOW TO PLAY: Enable the skill. Stand at least 6 steps away from your Alexa device. Then shout "Alexa, open What's the time Mr Wolf." Mr wolf will then tell you the time, which will be the number of steps you need to come closer.  If he says 3 O'clock. Then you need to take 3 steps closer to your Alexa device.  If you don't have much space then just do small steps when you are given the time. BE WARNED! Mr Wolf is a hungry chap and if you ask him the time enough it will eventually be DINNER TIME!! When it's dinner time you need to turn around and run away to safety. Safety can be your starting point or a base that you decided at the start of the game.   Good luck! ON SCREEN: If you have a device with a screen you will get to see what Mr Wolf looks like. Even when it's dinner time. FEEDBACK: If you loved the game then please do give the skill a 5 star rating and tell all your friends. If you hated the skill or have ideas on ways to improve the skill then please don't leave a negative review (it will break my heart). Send all that negative feedback to: Threadwell studios.  threadwellstudios@gmail.com I will do my best to improve the skill from that feedback and make it a 5 star skill for everyone :) Thanks for playing! Henry ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This skill was a collaboration with HUGO.FM Check them out for more great Alexa skills.

skill_name: Haathi Raja Kaha Chale - Indian Rhyme 🐘
skill_description: Haathi Raja depicts an elephant that roams in the village and visits different villagers. People in the village ask the elephant to pay a visit to their houses and be their guests. Further villagers offer food and stay to the elephant. Elephants are considered sacred in the Great Indian History because of lord Ganesha. Hence all the villagers love the visit of the elephant "Haathi Raja" in their small village. The poem will take you to the magic world of the Haathi Raja.  The Alexa skill is specially designed for kids of the age group 4-13 years old. We have updated the skill with a more smooth and fault-free experience. We are continuing the legacy of the previous skill with a more advanced and smooth voice experience. Haathi Raja will take you on an adventurous ride to the village. Whether it is time to sleep or dinner, play this rhyme for kids and your kid will love it. Steps for using the skill: Session 1: User: Alexa, start haathi raja Alexa: Starting haathi raja, you can say start or begin User: Start / Begin Alexa: Playing haathi raja User: Alexa, next User: Alexa, stop User: Alexa, shuffle User: Alexa, next / previous User: Alexa, resume User: Alexa, start over User: Yes/No Session 2: User: Alexa, start haathi raja Alexa: You were listening to haathi raja already, Would you like to resume? User: No Alexa: <Alexa starts over to play the audio from start> You are listening to the haathi raja. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Session 3: User: Help Alexa: You are listening to the haathi raja. You can say, Next or Previous to navigate through the playlist. At any time, you can say Pause to pause the audio and Resume to resume. Once invoked, Alexa will automatically start the conversation and play the audio. Sit back, relax, and enjoy the rhyme of haathi raja. To start again on finishing one story, you can ask Alexa to open it again by saying Alexa, start haathi raja When you reach the bottom of the playlist, try saying, Alexa, start over or Alexa, shuffle. However, all the audio are same which plays different versions of haathi raja.

Buzz in with Echo Buttons in this fun trivia game show. This game requires at least 2 Echo Buttons. Echo Buttons offer a new way to play game skills through your compatible Echo device. To learn more just ask "Alexa, what are Echo Buttons?"    Get two to four contestants together to star in this game show! In each round, Alexa will ask a question. Players will buzz in with their Echo Buttons to answer. As you play, Alexa will let you know if you're right or wrong and track your score. The contestant with the most correct answers wins!   While playing, you can say "Alexa, repeat that" to hear Alexa read the question again. You can also say, "Alexa, what are the scores?" to hear a score report. You can say, "Alexa, help!" to hear about what you can do next. You can say, "Alexa, start over" if you want to abandon the current game and pick up from the beginning. At any time you can say, "Alexa, stop" to halt the current game. If you had already started a game, Alexa will remember where you stopped and pick back up from the last question asked, when you next launch the skill. This skill was created using a Skill Blueprint. skill_name: King Minister Thief Police - Popular indoor game
skill_description: The game begins with making 4 chits namely Raja or king (1000 points) , Mantri or minister (800 points) , Chor or thief ( 0 points) and Sipahi or police (500 points). Each chit is randomly picked by alexa against the 4 players.Alexa discloses the raja or king and sipahi or police. The sipahi or police, then has to identify the ‘Chor’ or the thief, from the other 2 remaining players. If the sipahi or police, guesses correctly then the points are retained or else he/she surrenders them to the Chor or thief. Several rounds of this game are played before counting the points. The player with the highest score wins the game. The default winner is the player who reaches 10000 points first. The game helps develop cognitive thinking by requiring deductive reasoning. Voice cricket game is similar to book cricket game but instead of book we are using alexa.Book Cricket is an indoor game. It is popular among students in schools. Kids play this at home when the weather is not conducive for outdoor games. The easiness to play this game makes it more popular among kids. In our skill we are playing between user and alexa,where alexa will bat first and user has to chase the score. The overall match is of 2 over’s that is 12 balls. If the user reached the target in 12 balls (2.0 over’s) than the user is the winner else alexa is the winner How to Play book cricket: 1) Player has to randomly open the book and look for the page number 2) The player should always look for the side of book which has even numbers on it. 3) In the opened page, look for the even number and take note of the last unit in that number. For Example: If the opened page is 154, then the last unit is 4 so the score is 4. So the possible scores are 2, 4, 6, 8. 4)2, 4 and 6 score will be added to the batsman score as such and 8 will be counted as 3 runs, it is decided at the beginning of the game when the decide on the number of bats man. 5) Close the book and open it again. 6) Note the score for that again. 7) The innings will go on until 2.0 over’s is complete 8) At the end whoever has the bigger score is the Winner But for the voice cricket we need not have a book or pen ,Just an alexa with voice cricket game enabled skill How to Voice cricket: 1) Just enable skill and launch it 2) Once you have updated your name alexa will bat for 12 balls (2.0 over’s) and will give the target 3) You just have to hit the ball to score the runs ,rest alexa will take car. 4) You can bat for 2.0 over’s(12 balls) and chase the target Alexa will suggest the required runs from balls remaining

130+ Riddles for everyone:  ★50 HARD RIDDLES★ & ★50 EASY RIDDLES★ & ★30 NORMAL RIDDLES★ Ask for a new cool riddle and try to guess what's the answer: Phrases you can use to ask for a new riddle: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games a new riddle ♦ Alexa ask riddle games give me a riddle ♦ Alexa ask riddle games to tell me a new riddle Then try to guess the answer saying something like: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games is the answer to riddle fourteen orange? ♦ Alexa ask riddle games answer to riddle number five is blue ♦ Alexa ask riddle games the answer to riddle number two is red You will get a "YES!" or "...nope..." or "Heh, kinda, try again" based on how much you were close to the correct answer. If you are stuck, just ask: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games What's the answer to riddle ten? ♦ Alexa ask riddle games The answer to riddle number four ♦ Alexa ask riddle games What's the answer to number one? You'll get the correct answer, maybe you'll feel like a cheater.. i can't help with that but you can always ask for another riddle. If you think too much about a riddle you might forget what it was, or since this app will give you a random riddle, it might happen that you hear all the riddles except for one or two 'cause you're not lucky with randomness. Don't worry, just ask for a specific riddle: ♦ Alexa ask riddle games to repeat riddle twelve ♦ Alexa ask riddle games say again number three ♦ Alexa ask riddle games repeat riddle nine ■ This skill offers premium content, in the form of onetime purchases ■ You can purchase 2 in-skill products to extend the gameplay: ♦ 50 Hard riddles for the brightest minds ♦ 50 Easy riddles for the youngest minds Enjoy :D
