The Legend Sunny needs to be played with an echo show or echo spot. It is an Alexa-powered interactive adventure game with stories adapted from an old legend of the Formosa island. In this skill, you can tell your travel partner, Sunny Mei, what choices to make as you explore the Formosa island with various places, including the Fantasy Lake, Snake Temple, and Crescent Bay.  You will explore the Formosa island by choosing the adventure paths in the following order: 1. Accept Sunny Mei’s invitation to help her find her family in the Formosa island. 2. Select a native animal to ride on the Formosa island. 3. Travel up the Mountains and arrive in the aboriginal tribe. 4. Talk to the aboriginal girl Ah-Wei in the mountain area to find clues about Sunny Mei’s family. 5. Travel to the Fantasy Lake to find Sunny Mei’s family. 6. Explore the Snake Temple to find Sunny Mei’s family. 7. Search for Sunny Mei’s parents in the Crescent Bay.

In "4 plus 4" you can improve your calculating skills easily. At the moment you can select one of the following game modes: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, all-together. Each of them you can play on four different levels ranging from "rookie" to "genius".

A fun multiplication game for kids ideally aged between six and twelve - but anyone is welcome to try and beat Alexa! In Simple Mode, see how many points can you get answering multiplication questions which progressively get harder - up to 20x table Example:  Alex will ask "Six times five"  You need to give the answer "Thirty" or "The answer is Thirty" Or Battle Mode. Can your multiplication beat Alexa's answer? Can you ensure you don't use the same multiplication twice? Example:  Alexa will ask "Six times five equals Thirty"  You need to give a multiplication where the answer is higher than Thirty  "Six times Six equals Thirty-Six"  - But don't use the same answer twice as Alexa will know and will give you three chances to try again!

Few things stir up childhood nostalgia as quickly as a fresh box of crayons. It's even fun and entertaining to learn and discover names of crayons and challenge your friends. Guessing is allowed. How did Crayola come up with these names? One of them was Macaroni and Cheese crayon, named by a pasta-loving 6-year-old. Another famous color was named by a 12-year-old Sam Marcus, who drew small facial expressions to correspond with each new crayon. His “laughter” face was colored pink, hence Tickle Me Pink was born.

How to take a shot? You have five directions in which you can kick the ball when Alexa asks you to shoot. These are top right, top left, bottom right, bottom left and straight. Each time you take a shot, Alexa will randomly choose a direction in which the keeper will dive. If the two choices match, its a save but if they don't then you have scored a goal. Modes: There are two modes in which you can play the game, single player and multi player.  1. Single Player mode You will have endless amount of chances to try and score. In case your shot is saved by the keeper, you will get 3 additional chances to retry.  2. Multi Player mode This mode is for playing the game with friends and family locally. You will have the option to select the number of players which are playing the game. Once you select the number of players, Alexa will ask each player to take a shot in a round robin fashion. There will be five rounds in total and at the end of the last round you will get the final scorecard. Additional: At any point in the game, you can ask about the rules or your highscore.

Guess A Number is an interesting number game in which you have to predict the number between 1 to 100. Say Alexa open guess the number and it will ask you whether you want to play or not. then it will guide you to the correct number. You:- Open guess a number Alexa:- Would you like to play You:- Yes . . You:- three Alexa:- three is too low. You:- twenty two  Alexa:- twenty two is too high You:- twenty one Alexa:- 22 is correct answer. would you like to play again? Enjoy the game and do rate and review.

Your Uncle's master swords have been stolen. Your mission is to retrieve them by searching the four kingdoms. You'll do battle against grubby gramlins, hideous orcs, wicked-tongued witches, brain-hungry zombies and a horde of other fantastical creatures.  Words are your weapons! Defeat each enemy you encounter by spelling words correctly. Pick up special magical items for your backpack to aid you on your quest. Expand your vocabulary and flaunt your spelling prowess in three difficulty levels: Easy, tricky and masterful.  - Easy words are the easiest to spell. For young adventurers who are just learning starting out. - Tricky words are just a little bit harder. - Masterful words for older children, expert spellers and adults.  MasterSwords helps children and adults improve their spelling in a fun and exciting way. Explore a rich and fantastical universe with hidden surprises lurking around every corner.  HELPFUL HINTS: - If you need help at any point in the skill just say "help"! - Wondering how you're doing? say "status update" or "how am I doing?" - To use magic items you've collected during a battle say "backpack!" - To reset the skill say "reset." - Change your difficulty level by saying "change difficulty." - Keep an eye out for updates as we add new enemies, new scenes and more master swords!

Use your Echo buttons or your voice to play a fun winter game throwing snowballs.  Play in "Solo Mode" with a single player, or if you have buttons go "Head to Head" with two player mode. Listen carefully to each scenario, and see if you should throw a snowball. For example, if someone else is playing outside, you can throw at them, but don't go after the mailman or your mother with hot chocolate!  Act quickly as you don't have much time and other players are throwing at you, so be quick with your selection. If you have buttons, try the "Head to head" mode. The first player to hit the target scores a point, and Alexa tracks the score.  Don't be too quick with your buttons, else you might end up getting knocked out of the game.
Stuck for new Lego build ideas or want a new challenge? Ask Alexa to randomly choose a new Lego idea

The Color Caller Game is a simple game, perfect for kids of all ages. Just say, "Alexa, open Color Caller" to start the game. Alexa will say "Tag this color", and the first person to find or tag the selected color, wins! To continue playing, say "Next color", or "what color", or "next". Have Fun!

Have some Christmas fun by learning how to recite the names of Santa's reindeer. There are two modes: Practice mode : Alexa will read out the reindeer names and you have to say the name for each reindeer (remember the order as you will need to get them in order for the challenge mode) Challenge mode: Alexa will start off by asking you to say "Dasher" then she'll ask you 'Which reindeer comes after Dasher?' You have to say the next reindeer in the same order as practice mode.  The order of the reindeer is: Dasher, Dancer, Prancer, Vixen, Comet, Cupid, Donner, Blitzen and Rudolph Rudolph has been included as recent stories have depicted Rudolph at the front of the pack. Feedback and suggestions to steven.bowden@protonmail.com Privacy Information This skill does not collect or store any personal information. Data collected by the skill is not shared with any third party and is only used for the purpose maintaining the skill.

skill_name: Red Light Green Light Yellow Light
skill_description: This skill modernizes the game of Red Light Green Light with Alexa and Echo Buttons.  To begin you will need to trigger 1 echo button for this skill, then place the echo buttons at the finish line and have your players at the start line. When you are ready just say, 'Lets Start'. The first person to press the echo button at the finish line wins! (please note that because Echo Buttons communicate with Alexa via Bluetooth the Echo Buttons work best within 15 feet (4.5 meters) of your Alexa device.
Simple game skill that lets kids respond with the first letter to a bunch of random words.

Here's how it works You (Dealer) will have your guest (Player) select a card at random. Based on the card that Player selects, you will give me a specific command and I will "guess" the card. Full cheat sheet is below but for example, if Player selected the Ace of Clubs, you would say, "WHAT card was CHOSEN?" If Player selected the Ace of Spades, you'd say, "WHAT card was SELECTED?" Alternatively,  if Player selected the Two of Clubs, you'd say, "WHICH card was CHOSEN." Printable Key: Full key here: https://s3.amazonaws.com/kidscardtrick/Card+Trick+-+Kids+Edition+Table.pdf Hints (to remember key): The 1st letter of the suit matches the first letter of the verb (except Hearts): Spades = Selected; Clubs = Chosen; Diamonds = Drawn; Hearts = picked [it may be helpful to remember [hand] “picked” Odd numbers = “What” Even numbers = “Which” # cards = alphabetical order (e.g., Guess < Predict < Reveal < Tell us) Face cards = Starts with "So" KEY ------------------------------------ Spades - ...card was selected Clubs - ...card was chosen Diamonds - ...Card was drawn Hearts - ...card was [hand] picked - DO NOT SAY THE WORD HAND; IT’S TO HELP YOU REMEMBER HEARTS 1/A. What... 2. Which... 3. Guess what... 4. Guess which... 5. Predict what... 6. Predict which... 7. Reveal what... 8. Reveal which... 9. Tell us what... 10. Tell us which... J. So what... Q. So which... K. So guess what… Jokers. So guess which... FULL KEY A of Spades: What card was selected A of Clubs: What card was chosen A of Diamonds: What card was drawn A of Hearts: What card was picked 2 of Spades: Which card was selected 2 of Clubs: Have fun and improve your maths skills with silly sums. Perfect for practicing addition, subtraction and division.  Educational with an element of surprise. Ask Alexa for a silly sum, find out if you’re correct and listen to Alexa say words you’ve never heard before!  Develop your mental arithmetic at the same time as letting your imagine run wild.  Includes fun animal sound effects and cute graphics for devices with screens. Sums have never been so fun!

Superhero Info is a skill mainly for kids. It does as its name suggests, i.e., providing information of more than 700 superheroes! You can know more about your favorite ones or explore the less known heroes. Compare two superheroes in terms of their powers, know their publishers, birthplace, appearance, family details or know more about their ordinary jobs. This skill will keep kids engaged and help you answer the complex questions like Who will win the fight? Batman or Superman? How to use the skill? Just use the phrases: Ask super info who is Hulk? Ask super info How tall is Batman? Ask super info who will win between Batman and Superman? Ask super info who published Spiderman? Ask super info where was Batman born? Ask super info what does Captain America do?
Its an alexa skill which is basically a voice quiz game based upon Identification of Animal sounds. It supports upto 5 players and 10 animal sounds currently

Play the Outlier Game with Alexa, and see how good you are at identifying the patterns and find the "outlier" in a set of similar items.  Compete with your friends for added fun!   - Xylophone, guitar, brother, violin.   - Which word doesn't belong?   - Brother, because it's a relative, while the rest are musical instruments.  Easy, right?  Try this one.   - Spain, Japan, Argentina, Bolivia  - Which word doesn't belong?   - Japan, because all other countries in the list are Spanish-speaking   And things only get trickier from there!   Start with the "rhymes" or "mixer" pack until you get the hang of things.  Then move on to more challenging packs, like "places" and "animals," and show Alexa what you're really made of!  The game can be played by both adults and children. Just say "Alexa, start the Outlier Game". Good luck! We appreciate your feedback. Please send us a note at feedback@azalealabs.com if you have any suggestions how we can improve the game.

What Time is it Mr. Fox is a simple children's game. One player, the "fox", stands on one side of the room while everyone else stands on the opposite side of the room. The Fox stats with his back turned. The game starts by all the other players ask together "What time is it Mr. Fox?".          When the players ask "What time is it Mr. Fox?", the Fox replies with a time of the day of his/her choosing. If the Fox says 4 O'Clock everyone takes 4 steps forward. The Fox keeps his back turned. The game end when the Fox replies "Lunch Time!" and turns around and chases the players. The player the Fox eats(tags) will be the next fox.

When you just want to play the license plate game. This skill helps Alexa keep track of the states you and your family have seen on the road. After finding a new state Alexa will show you the state flag in the Alexa App. This requires a mobile version of Alexa, so it is best for someone in the car (not the driver) to add states via the Alexa App. If you own the Echo Auto you can use this skill hands-free. Example Phrases: - Alexa, ask the license plate game to add Massachusetts. - Alexa, ask the license plate game to list states. - Alexa, ask the license plate game to tell me our remaining states. - Alexa, ask the license plate game to remove Texas. If you have any questions or concerns email me at support@classroomleague.com.
The bot is looking for treasure on a 5x5 grid but doesn't know where it is.  Help the bot find it by directing it north, south, east or west on the grid.

Genius Junior is an Alexa Skill for kids to train their brain using extraordinary math challenges. Along with kids, parents can also play this for fun. This skill can also be used at school level for kids as well.  This skill has three levels, in which it will ask different combination of basic math operators (i.e. +, -, x, /). In the current version we have included addition and substraction only. We are working on next levels which will include division, multiplication between two and more than two numbers. Stay tuned for upcoming levels :) Level details: Level 1 -- Includes addition and substraction between two nubers from 0 to 9 Level 2 -- Includes addition and substraction between two nubers from 0 to 99 Level 3 -- Includes addition and substraction between two nubers from 0 to 1000 To start just say, Alexa, start Genius junior You can also ask for 'help' via saying 'help' and also select level via 'level one'.  There are total three levels (one, two and three). You can select any of above.

The fun quiz for children starting from 3 years! You will be asked a total of 10 questions from different categories. You will receive coins for correct answers. All other kids quiz players will also collect coins. The more coins you have, the higher you are in the junior quiz ranking. You will receive bonus points for the first quiz per day and for every tenth completed quiz. The quiz is constantly being expanded with new questions and categories. Have fun playing! GAME CATEGORIES > Animal voices Does the animal voice really correspond to the animal in question? > Guessing noises Can you really hear the sound we are searching for? > Colors Does the object really have the color in question? >Children television series Are the statements about children's television series really correct? The following series are currently included in the quiz:     - Bob the builder     - Fireman Sam     - Paw Patrol     - Peppa Pig > Objects, Nature, General Knowledge Are the statements really true? GAME CONTROLS - "YES" or "NO" to answer a question - "Repeat" to repeat a question. - "Help" for help - "Restart" to restart the kids' quiz.

Ever performed in the circus with a Swizzle Stomp monster? Or helped a baby sea monster get to sleep? From Sesame Workshop and HBO, the Esme & Roy skill brings the lively characters of the new animated series to your home. Monstersitting pros Esme and Roy will take your kids on pretend play adventures from the moon to a hot air balloon, encouraging children to move their bodies and use their imaginations to join the fun! And if your little monster ever is in need of a mindful moment, you can ask Esme and Roy for the calm down song at any time. To enable the skill, just say “Alexa, start Esme and Roy.” Having trouble? Say “Alexa, help” at any point during the skill. To quit, simply say “Alexa, stop.” The Esme & Roy skill is for kids ages 3+. For questions or comments, please email us at SesameWorkshopApps@sesame.org

With this skill, you can compete in a thrilling match of Rock, Paper, Scissors with Alexa! When Alexa says "shoot", pick either "Rock", "Paper", or "Scissors" and see who wins! To play, install the skill and tell Alexa: "Alexa, launch Rock Paper Scissors Shoot"

skill_name: Lion and Mouse Game - Can you ACT
skill_description: In this Game, Alexa will narrate you the wonderful famous lion and mouse story.  In the middle of the story, Alexa will act like a lion and consider your kids to be a mouse.  Kids have to follow Alexa's voice and act same as it is asked to do so. The Alexa conversation designed to be more interactive for your kids to increase their listening skills.  Enable this Alexa skill and enjoy listening to the story while your kid acting on it.  Please provide your suggestion and feedback at learninone.com@gmail.com. If your kids enjoying this acting game, please don't forget to give your stars.

Welcome to Kid Chef!  You’ve just started as junior chef at the world famous Lello restaurant. For each important guest that visits, help decide on the tastiest menu before cooking each dish to perfection. Please the guests and impress the scary Head Chef Antoine to win the game! This is a fun imagination game for kids aged 6+. If your child has ever played pretend kitchen, this is the game for them! Level Two is coming soon! Your mission is to fly your spaceship to the planet Mars that has a colony of cats.  Unfortunately they cats have been overrun by aliens and need to be saved.  Using your echo buttons, go onto an adventure to save the cats!    Just press two Echo buttons to get started, then listen carefully to the sounds played. If you hear an alien, press the red button and you will zap it with your laser. If you hear a cat, press the blue button to save it, and move on to the next sound. The game tracks how many cats you can save.  If you can find ten to bring home on your spaceship, you will win the game!

This skill gets your kids up and moving by giving them hundreds of random scenes they can act out. A monkey changing a light bulb in space? No problem! A vampire walking a tightrope with his eyes closed? Piece of cake! To play the game, have Alexa open "Who? What? How?". You can ask for help at any time. Once a scene is selected, you can choose to "skip" it, or act it out. Fun background music will play for about 30 seconds followed by applause! Get your kids moving and using their imaginations with Who? What? How?

Learn all about nouns, verbs, adverbs and adjectives with this fun and interactive game.  Help Captain Cursive with his quest to take back his dictionaries from the evil "Scallywag of Good Grammar" by solving grammar questions. You will fire cannons at his ship by answering a series of Grammar questions, if you get it right you will hit the pirate ship, get it wrong and you miss!  Recommended age 4-8 years old. We want to make Grammar Pirates even better, please send us your ideas, issues or feedback to:  hello@grammarpirates.com - We are listening...
Bringing your favorite childhood game of stone paper scissors on your favorite voice assistant

This skill challenges you to find the correct color code is as few turns as you can.  After each guess you will be told how many colors are in the correct position and how many are in the incorrect positions, but not which ones are which.

Welcome to Guess the Letter! I will pick a letter of the alphabet and you guess what it is. If you are wrong, I will tell you whether the letter I am thinking of is later or earlier in the alphabet.  For example, I might think of the letter 'L', and would start by asking you to make a guess. You could start by saying "A". Because 'L' is later than 'A', I would tell you that the letter I'm thinking of is later in the alphabet. You then might say "Is it E?". Because 'L' is also later in the alphabet than the letter 'E', I would again tell you that the letter I'm thinking of is later in the alphabet. Next, you might say "How about X?" This time, you picked a letter later in the alphabet than 'L', so I would tell you that the letter I'm thinking of is earlier in the alphabet than 'X'. You might then guess "L", and I would tell you that you guessed my letter and won the game!

Let Alexa be your moderator in the classic party game, duck duck goose.  Sit down in a circle. Alexa will start saying duck...duck...duck....when she says goose the person who's turn it is has to get up and run. The person across from them has to catch them! If you couldn't catch them, you're the goose!  Have fun!  Please encourage us to create more games by leaving a review. For comments or suggestions, we're always at pretzel.voice@gmail.com Music by the great and widely popular Ben Sounds

The game is bees flowers bears.  Sometimes the bee wins, sometimes the flower wins, and sometimes the bear wins!  It is similar to rock, scissors, paper, but with some educational trivia and geared for kids!   _______________ This is how you play the game: First, I will ask you if you are a bee, a flower or a bear.   After you answer, I will take my turn and RANDOMLY answer bee, flower or bear.  The winner is determined and the current score is announced.  Then, I will tell you an educational fact about bees, flowers or bears.  Afterwards I will ask if you would like to play another round. _______________ Here is how the winner is determined: Bees collect nectar from flowers, and when this happens, the bee wins.   Bears provide fertilizer for the flowers, and when this occurs, the flower wins.  Bears collect honey from the bees, and when this occurs, the bear wins. _______________ You can play as many times as you like, and I love this game so much I never get tired! _______________ Update January 6, 2020: The emotional quality of Alexa's voice has been enhanced to express a sense of excitement and disappointment depending on game outcome. Update, December 31, 2018: A scoring system which tracks the winner of each round has been added. _______________  Your review will help us continue to improve this skill.  You may also contact us at support@voices.app if you need assistance, or for your suggestions and comments. Thank you. Credits: Development: https://voices.app Linguistics Consultant: LaLa Speights Icon Image: Pexels

oll Up! Roll Up! It's time to play Musical Bumps with Alexa. When the music starts, it's time to go crazy and throw some shapes! Dance like you've never danced before. When the music stops....BUMP! Everybody to the ground! The last person to sit down is out. Keep dancing and bumping until you're left with a winner! Kids and grown-ups love to play this game. Similar to musical chairs and musical statues it's perfect for parties or playing amongst friends on a rainy indoor day. If you love Musical Bumps, please take the time to leave a 5 star review so we can add more features! Feedback is always welcome at hello@topvoiceapps.com

Pronounced as  'fro'- 'gee',  "fro G Counting Game" is a skill to help kids at early stage learning to both count and recognise/distinguish sounds. This free basic package uses our frog-like character - "fro-G" to provide an entertaining way for young children to distinguish sounds and learn to keep count in time  with a musical track. You can say: "Alexa, open fro G Counting Game" "Alexa, start fro G Counting Game" "Alexa, launch fro G Counting Game" **v1.1 - Basic Package** There are currently 6 tracks on this app, using a "bounce" or "ribbit" sound effect to count with - all to the tune of our signature background tune!  We'll definitely look to add a greater variety of tracks and increased complexity if fro-G proves to be popular! Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, and any constructive comments will help us improve this app to provide further enhancements for your kids to interact with!

Do you like solving number problems? If you said yes, then this new exciting and fun Alexa game called Number Quiz is for you to play with friends and family. Not only this game is intuitive but will help you to think fast while still having fun. The objective of this game, is to find numbers when added them together, they equal the number Alexa is looking for. The catch is, you can only choose numbers from the five option numbers that Alexa will provide you.   Please make sure to have a pen and a paper to write down numbers to help you when playing at a higher level. You can invoke this skill by saying "Alexa, open Number Quiz". Please feel free to contact us at quizmemore@yahoo.com for any issues or feedback you might have. We would love to hear from you about this skill to help us make this a better experience for everyone.

Become the ultimate space hero by enabling this game! Your adventure will start on Earth and will continue throughout space.  You will help your crew, Mary and James, to accomplish the mission by answering different questions! There are four stages in the game that includes launching your Space shuttle, travelling through space, visiting the Moon and completing the mission on Mars.  Remember that you will have a score, you will get 10 points for each correct answer, 20 points for each completed stage, 5 points if you return the next day and 20 if you come back 3 days in a row  ***Parents: This game lets you play 1 level for a day, and you can get more points if you continue playing daily. Plus. it includes questions and facts about STEM, so enjoy this game while learning! If you enjoyed this game please leave us a review to continue working on more missions! If you have more comments or suggestions, please e-mail us at uriel.alcantara.16@gmail.com. Thanks for playing!

children calculation game Since my daughter soon attends the first class of school and has a lot of fun with math, I have developed the „children calculation game“ Skill. It is intended to consolidate the basic arithmetic operations in a playful way. children calculation game has different math tasks, this version of the skill calculates up to 20 and only adding and subtracting is practiced. You can set up your personal highscore and try to crack it with every new start, so the joy of children calculation game remains longer and a certain ambition is aroused. Skill start: "Alexa open children calculation game " It is always possible to go back to the main menu and select a new calculation type. Just say "Menu". End skill: "End" This skill is also suitable for the Echo Show and Echo Spot. If you have one of these devices, the task will be shown on the above mentioned devices. Please note that you have to activate skills for children in the Amazon Alexa App to use this skill. We would appreciate any feedback / evaluation and suggestions for improvement / suggestions for further functions. Hints: The Amazon-Device-UserID is stored in a database so that the highscore can be assigned. You can remove both your Highscore and your UserID from the database at any time. Please contact us at info@skillprojekt.com. for this purpose.

Classical word chain game with Animals. Compete against Alexa chaining animal names without repeating any. You only need to say an animals name whose first letter match with the last letter of the previous animal name.  It's perfect as an entertainment for kids and adults. Also cool to use in educational environments. This game is really easy to use. You just need to tell alexa to start the game by saying for example: "Alexa, run Animal Chain" or "Alexa, start Animal Chain".  Then Alexa will start. First it will ask you if you know the rules, if you do, you will go straight to the game. If you don't, Alexa will explain the rules with an example.  Alexa always starts saying the animal, so you can take your time to search for another animal that match it's first letter with the last letter of the animal Alexa said, there is no time limit. If you didn't hear Alexa's animal name, or you forgot, you can ask Alexa to repeat it by saying: "can you repeat?" or " say again". If you don't know any animals, just say "I don't know more" or "I surrender". To exit the game just say: "Stop" or "Cancel".

You are off on a jungle adventure saving lost animals.  You have a rescue truck to save them with, but watch out for those pesky bugs that are buzzing around. Fortunately you have a fly swatter, and can take care of them when the come too close. This game uses either your voice, or two echo buttons. Listen carefully to the the sounds played through your Echo device.   If you have two Echo buttons, press them at the start to set them up, then listen carefully to the sounds played. If you hear an insect, press the red button or say 'smash' to get the bug. If you hear an animal, press the blue button to save it or say 'save', then continue your search for more animals. The game tracks your score. See how many you can get in a row and fill up the rescue truck!

Let your kids play smart dice game and become the smartest player in World. You can be the coolest player and have your name shine on the Leader board. Keep playing, keep winning, improve your knowledge by answering simple questions, and hold your place tight on the leader board. Questions mainly consists of general knowledge and math.  Your kids can play smart dice with you, their friends or even when they are all by themselves. They will get rewarded for their knowledge which will keep them motivated.  Scores will be stored and compared with other players across your country for a place on the Leader board. Newer questions will be added every day, so keep playing and keep getting back for updates. Happy Lucky trip!! Rules *************************************************** User will have to score 100 points for winning the game. Can play in Single Player or Multiplayer mode. If the user has scored 99 Points, he/she should get another 1 point to win. In multiplayer mode, the one who scores 100 point first will be winner. If the User scores 99 points, then he/she should get 1 point to win. If user gets a 6 when he is at 99, the additional points won't add, and there will be negative marks for wrong answers. In short, the users will have to get an exact 100 to win the game. Any number of Players can be added to the game.  Single Player can play any number of times. Can Resume the game after any number of Days. Dice points ************************************************************* If the dice rolls 1, he will get 1 point for the right answers and -1 for a Wrong answer. If the dice rolls 2, he will get 2 points for the right answers and -2 for a Wrong answer. If the dice rolls  3, correct answer will be rewarded with 3 points and wrong answer will make you loose 3 points If the dice rolls  4, correct answer will be rewarded with 4 points and wrong answer will make you loose 4 points when rolled 5, correct answer gives +5, wrong answer gives -5 points roll 6 for 10 Points Bonus. You can pause: "Alexa, pause" You can check your status at any point in game by saying, "Alexa, what is my status" you can ask Alexa to repeat question by saying "Alexa, repeat the question." For more detailed description and scoring details, visits us at: https://pohostaging.club/smartDice/

Color Changer offers children and kids of all ages a creative means by which they can express themselves through the beauty of colors on Echo buttons. With a click of a button, users can get a color on the Echo button, which is especially engaging for the little ones!

World of Equestria is both a skill of facts about My Little Pony - Friendship is Magic, and a fun trivia game to play on your own or with friends. This kids skill is not affiliated, licensed, or endorsed by Hasbro.  It's a family friendly, fan created unofficial guide to Equestria and a trivia game, built for fans of the show of all ages.  You can listen to some random facts about the show, or you can play a trivia game about it.  Do you know all there is to know about Equestria? Play the game every day to see if you can answer the random sets of questions correctly. Designed with 2 main parts and 1 surprise:   *Equestria fact: Alexa randomly chooses a fact to tell.  You can listen to just one, or as many as you like. *Equestria trivia game: A series of 3 random questions.  The goal, get all 3 correct.  If you get some wrong, there's a bonus question if you want it.  You should be able to play every day and always get a different combination of questions. *The hidden surprise:  This is my favorite part.  Within each step, Alexa will ask if you want to continue.  If you answer with something she won't recognize (you can say anything to trigger this hidden part, so go nuts,) Alexa will say randomly crazy Equestria related pony things in response, then she repeats her original question. To start the skill, you can say: "Alexa, open World of Equestria" "Alexa, start World of Equestria" "Alexa, launch World of Equestria" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill.  Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep improving upon this skill and making even more great skills, thanks!

Help! The animals have escaped, and you need to bring them back by completing different patterns. Animal Patterns is an educational game for preschool and kindergarten-age kids who are developing an awareness for patterns. The game presents a series of patterns and asks kids to complete them. Example patterns: - bear, lion, bear, lion -> What comes next? - dog, rooster, turkey, dog, rooster, turkey, dog, rooster -> What comes next? Animal Patterns automatically adjusts the difficulty of patterns based on prior responses. Patterns are randomly generated - play multiple times for different types of patterns. If you love this skill, please leave a 5-star review below! Feedback is always welcome at feedback@conversantdesign.com.

Start with "Alexa, open Animal Sounds Quiz". Listen to the questions being asked and answer the animal's name. There are 10 questions, and there are 3 hints per question. If you want to hear the calling voice again, say "again". If you want to end it, say "end". If you want to start over, say "Start again". We hope you enjoy it with your children.

skill_name: Train Your Brain : Number Chain Game
skill_description: The Number Chain Game is a part of memory training skills that allows you to train your ability to remember sequences of digits. The game will start with a single digit and Alexa will keep on adding a new digit till you can remember the sequence of digits. This is a fun way to pass time and sharpen your memory in the process. Try to set a high score and challenge your friends to a memory battle. How to play: 1. The game will begin by Alexa giving you a number to memorize. 2. Speak back the number to Alexa, if correct it will give you the second number. 3. Now repeat both the numbers in the sequence given by Alexa. 4. Alexa, will then give you another number and the game will go on till you repeat the right sequence. 5. At any point in the game, say start over to start the game again, say high score to know your high score and help to know the rules again while playing. CHANCES: You will get 3 chances to retry when you give a wrong answer.

skill_name: Guess the Animal: Animal Sounds Game
skill_description: This animal game is all about fun. Can you guess what the cat sounds in Japanese language? How does the mouse squeak to a Swedish ear? Find it out right away! Play a guessing game with Alexa and discover both livestock and wild animals in entertaining skill. Oddly enough, nature sounds differently across the globe. People of various nations have seem to hear barking and chirping in their own way. In this game for kids and adults you are to guess the animal by the sound Alexa makes. It will also give you a few clues to prompt the correct answer.

Fairy Tale Feud is an easy to play kid-friendly game with fun contests between fairy tale creatures. The Evil Witch is trying to take over the Enchanted Forest and only you can help the good fairy tale creatures.  You'll take part in series of contests to determine the fate of the Enchanted Forest.  If you get 5 good creatures into the Forest before the Witch you will beat her!   On each turn you will select who to send into the forest, the rules are simple: - Giants always defeat Elves since they are so much bigger and stronger. - Wizards always beat Giants by using magic on them. - Elves will always defeat a Wizard by tricking him.  You may also be joined by special characters from time to time!   The game is enhanced with images on devices with displays.  Good luck, the fate of the Enchanted Forest is in your hands!

Money Math is a game for kids and adults of all ages. Practice and improve your mental math and skills with money in this fun quiz game. Questions include calculating change, taking percentages, and adding and subtracting money values. Compete for a high score and try and beat your family and friends. The goal of Money Math is to help make math practical and enjoyable for kids, students, and even adults. Mental math skills with money are extremely important in day to day life. Spend some time with Money Math to improve your skills today! To play the game, say 'Alexa, money math.' Then say 'play' and answer the questions by saying '10 dollars and 47 cents.'

Breaking Boredom is a skill to help kids break out of the boredom blues by giving them lots of fun activity ideas. How many times have kids been home from school on a weekend, spring or summer breaks and say to their parents... "I'm Bored, there's nothing to do!" We all know that's not quite the case. There's tones of things to do... they are just stuck and need a bit of inspiration to get their imaginations going.  Now, with this list of great indoor and outdoor ideas, they will now be saying: "Alexa, open breaking boredom" "Alexa, start breaking boredom" "Alexa, play breaking boredom" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill, or send us an email with your suggestions at tfbllc3@gmail.com. abc BINGO is a skill designed to help children develop and practice alphabet recognition.  Alexa is the bingo caller and will call out random LETTERs of the alphabet.   Physical game requirements: a prepared bingo card and playing pieces to cover the letter squares.  An abc BINGO card can be purchased or prepared at home or in the classroom.  It is  typically composed of sixteen squares, with one letter of the alphabet in each space.  The game offers both regular bingo as well as a blackout version.   Moms and preschool teachers - you can mix it up a bit and EASILY ADJUST this game to your child's or pupil's learning level by preparing a variety of different Bingo cards.   Examples - make it more difficult by preparing bingo cards with twenty-five squares or less difficult by preparing cards with nine to twelve squares.  Other Variations - prepare bingo cards using all capital letters, using all lower case letters, or using a random selection of upper and lower case letters. Let’s make abc BINGO even better! When we reach TEN, 5-Star reviews for this skill in the Alexa app, the developer promises to upgrade the skill by adding MORE variations of ABC Bingo. Possible enhancements include 1) Alexa calling out specific upper or lower case letters, such as Capital A, a little k, a capital M, etc., 2) Alexa calling out words that begin with the letter required.   So, by leaving a 5-star review you tell the developer it’s worth putting in more time and effort into development. It's a win-win, right? It costs you nothing but a little time, and inspires further development.   So that's how you can easily do your part to help improve and motivate the development of this skill...where else can you do that?  Now, go enjoy playing abc BINGO and we'll get to work developing some cool enhancements.  Let's make learning FUN! Just say, "Alexa, open abc BINGO", to start playing.  You can also say: "Alexa, start abc BINGO" "Alexa, launch abc BINGO" Please leave a 5-star review if you love this skill. Your 5-star reviews encourage us to keep making more great skills, thanks!

The Hide and Seek skill helps your kids play the classic game of Hide and Seek. It is fun for kids of all ages and requires a minimum of two players, one to seek and at least one to hide. Alexa prompts the players to decide who will hide and who will seek. The Hide and Seek skill gives basic instructions for the seeker to close and hide their eyes and for the other players to go hide when Alexa says "Ready, set, go". Alexa is the Hide and Seek counting helper, counting slowly from one to ten before saying, "Ready or not, here I come."  To try it out, just say "Alexa, open Hide and Seek." Challenging word game to train your gray matter and extend your vocabulary.  Rules are simple: you tell the letter, app tells next letter, who ends with a complete word loose the round.  So far it plays only with single words (so it will never guess an Old English Sheepdog or a Whale Shark for instance). You can use only nouns and never names, cities or else.  If you face problems with one letter recognition, try to use NATO phonetic alphabet: : Alfa, Bravo, Charlie, Delta, etc.  Or just try saying any word starting with your letter.

We are constantly working on adding more objects to the game!

The skill plays chess. Chess is unique in a sense because it allows users to make moves with or without the board. The skill allows user to select standard times and delays as well as an approximate ELO rating. The game uses stockfish which is a very strong engine.

This is a game to collect points. based on the points levels parents can have prizes.

For fans of Sideways Stories from Wayside School, Captain Underpants, and Roald Dahl, Classroom 13 is the perfect adventure for kids of all ages.     Don't worry, there's no homework in Classroom 13, just weird, wacky, and wild adventures—that YOU get to choose!   When unlucky teacher Ms. Linda LaCrosse finds a magic lamp, she releases a genie—sorry, djinn—who agrees to grant each of her students ONE WISH. Now it's YOUR TURN! What would YOU do with one MAGIC WISH? This interactive storytelling experience puts you in control as you choose where and how the story unfolds. Put on your fun hat and experience hundreds of unique adventures with the world’s wonkiest classroom. Just say "Alexa, open Classroom Thirteen" to get started. If your children enjoy the audio adventures, make sure to check out the book series, starting with Texas Library Association’s 2018 Texas Bluebonnet Award nominee, The Unlucky Lottery Winners of Classroom 13!

Your kids can learn colors in a fun and engaging way with this skill! Alexa will pick a random every day object, phrase, or other common sense idea to quiz your kids on, and then keep going as long as they want. Some fun examples: * "What color is the part of a watermelon that you eat?" * "What color are strawberry milkshakes?" * "Fill in the blank: I'm ___ with envy!" * "What do you get when you mix yellow and blue?" Your kids will have a blast learning about colors this way! Maybe you'll learn some things too!

Can you make sense of Fannee Doollee? Fannee is a fun girl to know, once you have her figured out. Fannee Doollee is a fun word puzzle requiring observation, deduction and savvy.Through a series of three challenges you need to try and understand this very peculiar young lady.

Your team down by one point, you have possession of the ball, and ten second left. This is the moment that every basketball player have been waiting for and prepared for their whole lives. This skill will help you live that dream.

The book cricket skill aids in developing basic addition skills for kids aged between 7-10, while engaging them in a competitive game of book cricket. Like cricket, the game is played by 2 kids, with each of them adding runs in their respective innings. A random number between 0-6 is generated indicating the number of runs scored on the particular ball. The kid needs to keep track of the total score by adding the runs scored on each ball.  Next ball is bowled only when the kid prompts the present score. If he prompts the wrong score, a wicket is taken. Each kid is given two wickets per innings. Hence, the kid with the highest score wins, i.e the one who successfully adds up to the highest total. For example, if kid one sets up a total score of 50 , the second kid needs to successfully add the scores to 51 before the 2 wickets are taken.
Test your knowledge of recycling facts and fiction by playing OVMoD Recycling Trivia! How much trash does the world create every year? Why is it so important to recycle? Discover today!

Suitable for individuals or small groups, Bobo will provide the solution whenever boredom may strike!

How many carrots can you bring back?
