An Alexa Skill for children 10 and over! Tey Shawn goes on an adventure with his friends to find the golden MacGuffin! In doing so, he'll accomplish his mission of becoming a great intrepid explorer and space pirate just like his father! Ready to follow along? Find your nearest Amazon Echo Show, any Alexa-enabled device, or use echosim.io, and say: Open the Golden MacGuffin! This skill is an interactive adventure game for anyone who loves loves all things science fiction, fantasy, and adventure!

Stand up and get ready to play a simple but sophisticated Simon Says game! Alexa will give you a command. If the command starts with the phrase "Simon Says" you have to follow it. But be careful, if she doesn't say "Simon Says" and you follow the command you lose! This skill keeps track of what you're doing at any time so that Alexa's instructions always make sense! You will never get conflicting instructions and some tasks will continue for multiple turns. The game is especially fun to play with a group of people. Once the last person is eliminated just say "I lose" to hear your score and how many rounds you managed to complete. Enjoy this fun, active, and surprisingly challenging classic game!
Not sure what to talk about on your road trip or around the dinner table? Let Chit Chat help by posing questions that generate some pretty interesting--and sometimes hilarious--responses.
Let people have fun playing the red light green light game.

In Math Adventurer, players go on adventures that help hone their math skills along the way. In order to advance through the game, you'll have to successfully answer addition problem. To defeat the dragon, you must enter its lair and explore the 10 rooms in the lair. Each room is locked and will need 1, 2, or 3 keys to open it. To get the keys to open the doors, you must unlock magical treasure chests that can only be opened by solving math problems.

Speechy trivia is a grammar quiz game for kids around 10 to 13. Speechy's enthusiastic host guides players through the game, giving encouraging feedback and fun facts after each response. Every game is three questions long and lasts between three and five minutes. Have fun playing!

This is the traditional "I spy with my little eye" game for Alexa. She tells you where she is and what she's spying, and you have to guess! The places and objects are suitable for children aged 5 to 7. The objective of this game isn't just to entertain them, but also to develop their object grouping and characterisation skills.

With this skill, you can get information about  All DC and Marvel Superheroes of all time. It's a Fact skill, tells the facts of the different characters. Useful for some unique facts about Superheroes characters.

A fantasy exploration game where Alexa is your Dungeon Master! Kids navigate a dungeon and encounter strange creatures and must solve their progressively difficult arithmetic word problems to proceed. If they reach the end they must confront a mighty wizard and a final challenge. If they succeed they discover a secret word of the day they can share with friends. Math dungeon provides a fun daily adventure for elementary school children to improve their math skills.

The Make Believe skill encourages kids to play make-believe games by suggesting games and characters for them to play. The skill simply suggests the games - it doesn't play the games, that's up to the kids themselves! We're going to add THOUSANDS of fun game ideas to the skill, so it never runs out. It was inspired by our own kids, who love making up games - about Kings and Queens, aliens, monsters, adventurers and so much more. We hope you have as much fun using it as we had making it!

Alien invasion has three alien-themed games that can be played on any alexa enabled device (echo,dot,tap,show). Each of the games is targeted to teach and practice a different skill in an entertaining way to kids.  First game, Teach-The-Word asks kids to teach new words to the alien visitors using word analogies. They get alien-coins in return for teaching them correct words and reinforcing their knowledge. Eg, Aliens know that “Celsius” is connected to “Temperature” by some relation (unit of measurement), kids have to guess what should “Meter” be related to so aliens can learn a new connection. Periodically, kids also reinforce their knowledge by correcting the sets aliens have made themselves based on previous sets. Second game, Spaceships is about attacking alien ships with equations that equate to a number where the ship is located. Kids start with the “weapon” (aka mathematical operator) of addition and as they play more rounds, they unlock new weapons: subtraction, multiplication and division. Once they have more weapons available, they can decide which one they want to use for each attack. An example of an attack is: if Alexa says there is a spaceship at location 25, it can be destroyed by the kid saying “twenty plus five” (since it equates to the correct location).  And Finally, the third game I-Know-What-I-Know, Aliens try to engage kids in a trivia to test whether they “really” know the answers or if they’re just guessing. Kids get more points answering honestly rather than guessing.

Every day, test your knowledge on 6 new facts in Nature, Science, Animals, History and many more! Some of them are true, and some of them are false. But watch out, there are trick facts every day that are looking to trip you up! You'll earn points for every fact you get correct, and when you get enough you'll level up! Whether you get facts right or wrong, you'll still have fun learning tons of facts on all kinds of topic. This skill is aimed at children aged 6-12. If your child is on the younger end, you may want to play with them to help out with the answers. This skill can help improve your child's listening comprehension skills as they'll need to pay close attention to each fact.

Hi! I'm Emily Ann! I live on a big farm with my family and lots of animals! Tomorrow I'll be six years old! Can you help me find my birthday present? This interactive story allows you to journey with Emily Ann around her farm. You help Emily Ann by choosing where to search; will you look in the big red barn, or the chicken coop? Enjoy the sights and sounds of a farm as you and Emily Ann engage with a myriad of farm yard animals. Will you find her present before the party, or will Emily Ann have to wait until after the cake to open her gifts?  Come on, let's go find out!

Shiritori is a word chaining game that helps with vocabulary. Alexa will say a word, and your word needs to start with the last letter of that word. This game will go on for twenty rounds, or it will last forever in the unlimited mode. The longer your words are, the more points you will get.
Be a Mathematics Detective! Solve the problems given the clues. The questions are a mix of addition, subtraction and multiplication.

The Last Coin is a kid-friendly strategy game based on the mathematical game, Nim. Take turns against Alexa to grab coins from the jar. If you grab the last coin, you win! Try and beat Alexa on both easy and hard difficulty! Play now by saying, "Alexa, let's play the coin game".

Times Table Madness offers a fun and exciting new way for kids to practice their times tables.  Instead of just asking you the usual times table questions, Alexa will ask you to multiply silly objects. For example, she may ask you “What is ten times eight pineapples,” or "What is seven times twelve smelly socks." To score a point you would need to answer with “Eighty pineapples,” or "Eighty four smelly socks." Alexa is quite generous in her scoring. So if you get the answer right, but say the wrong silly object, she'll probably let you off!  You can ask Alexa to test you on any number, so it's fun for older kids and adults too. Why not try the 256 times table.  Once you have chosen your times table, by saying e.g. "Test me on seven," Alexa will ask you 6 questions. After answering all the questions, she gives you a final score and tells you how long it took you to answer all the questions.  See if you can beat your friends and family by scoring full marks in the fastest time.  But most importantly... have fun!

Want an alternative to boring math flash cards? Or simply tired of thinking up math problems for your kids to practice? Try 1 + 1 Math and have your kids practice addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division problems on their own.

A fun quiz on how well you know your opposites. You might learn a few on the way! The game ends when you get three strikes. The words are fit for kids in preschool, kindergarten, and early elementary school. It is great vocabulary practice.
Endangered animal quiz for kids. Learn about different endangered species and their lifestyles!
Let's find out who's the fastest by testing everyone's speed at various tasks! A fun game for adults and kids. Logo made with Logomakr.com
This is a simple game where the objective is to find the odd one out. You will be given 10 questions each with three items, you have to decide which one is the odd one out.

Save the Princess is a choose your own adventure story designed with young children in mind. Alexa will prompt you with a piece of the story, and then she'll present you with options you can choose that will lead you in different directions. Along the way you'll be presented with basic questions to encourage learning, like simple math, rhyming, or riddles. The end goal is to save the princess.

There are three games: Gypsy, Fortune Teller, and Pokemon Battle. Gypsy is a game where you can ask several questions and Gypsy will answer your question with a yes, no, or a maybe. Fortune Teller is a game where u can ask Alexa for your fortune, and Alexa will simply give you your fortune. Lastly, Pokemon Battle is a story telling game. All you have to do is make several choices, and the story will change depending on what you choose. Pokemon Battle has many different scenarios, so you may play multiple times. It's also your choice if you want to play another game after each time you play. *If you have trouble at any time, say "help." These are the question you may ask while playing Gypsy: 1. Will I die soon 2. Will I go to college 3. Will I get a good job 4. Will I become a doctor 5. Will I become a hobo 6. Do I love my dog 7. Do I love my cat 8. Do I love my family 9. Does my dog love me 10. Does my cat love me 11. Does my family love me *Alexa will answer with a yes, no, or maybe

Traverse the "lower 48" by driving from state to state in this simple and easy-to-play game. Conserve fuel and don't waste your paycheck as you complete assigned trips from coast to coast that change every hour! Think you know how to get from Maine to Oregon? State the State is free to enable and play forever. Enjoy! State to State can be played by kids of all ages but is particularly directed towards kids under 13.

Alexa will whisper a city name and you have to listen to it carefully and reply with the correct name whispered by Alexa. If your answer is correct you will get the ticket to visit the city else if the answer is incorrect, Alexa will give you a hint. You can ask Alexa to repeat by saying "repeat" or "say that again".

Trivia game using amazon Alexa and the Alexa app. A country's flag will be shown on the home screen of your Alexa app, and you will have to guess what country it belongs to. Start the skill by saying "Alexa, start the country flag quiz" Be sure to have a smartphone or computer on hand with access to the Amazon Alexa app or alexa.amazon.com, as the country flags will be displayed on a card on the app home screen.

Think you know our presidents? Think again. Imagine this: your name is Thomas Jefferson, and you've just received word that Aaron Burr is planning to create a new country within your borders. What do you do? Do you sit back and watch as your former Vice-President takes your land? Or do you fight for your country by answering his Presidential Trivia? We hope you chose the latter. Presidential Quest is a game for all ages which will test your knowledge of all 45 Presidents through a fun game setting. All information contained in the game is factually accurate and will be great discussion-starters at the dinner table. So what are you waiting for? Go save the Union!

We know reciting geography facts is no fun. Instead, "Find Benny" puts the user in a world of travel and adventure. The world is vast, which is why "Find Benny" has information on close to 100 of the most influential and prevalent cities in the world, spanning six continents. Our clues range from celebrities to regional musical snippets to local delicacies and attractions, totaling almost 2000 interesting facts about these global cities! Examples of clues: He sent you a ticket stub from Van Gogh Museum. Benny just sent you a picture of the local money. They use Rupee. He just sent you a selfie with Mark Wahlberg! Whoa! All you need for this skill are your wits, your imagination, and an Echo. No passport required. Intro Music from www.bensound.com

Welcome to Alphabet Adventure. Let's explore Alphabet Land! Fun and interactive way to learn ABCs. This skill will teach children new words and alphabet by asking 26 questions! A to Z, everything is covered. What are you waiting for? Try it out now!

Homework Heroes is a skill that makes homework entertaining by allowing kids play short quizzes on the Alexa. You can either play any game or find a list of available games https://HomeworkHeroes.co.uk and shout out the four digit code to play them. Parents and teachers can login to https://HomeworkHeroes.co.uk with their Facebook account and create their own games (ideally based around the stuff their kids are doing that week in school).  Kids can then use the Echo to play the games set by their parents or friends or teachers. Of course, not everyone has the time to make their own games so the idea is the community creates a ton of games to play.
This skill allows a user to play a quiz game about creatures.

Looking for a game that can be played with your family and friends that is engaging and challenging? Memory Game for Kids is the game for you! The game will present a small list of words(over 100 total different ones!) to you and then ask a question about the list. Make sure to memorize the list in order to answer the question! An example would be “what word was before dog?”  This game can be played alone, or with friends working together to score on all rounds! The game offers two difficulty modes, normal and hard. Normal repeats the word list every round, while hard does not. Hard offers the extra challenge for those wanting to practice their memory as you have to remember the list purely in your mind from start to finish! Enable Memory Game for Kids and start testing your memory today! This skill does not collect any information or require any setup or account information.

Diabetes is one of the biggest common diseases in the world. Unfortunately, many do not take the disease seriously. Children are mostly affected by type 1 diabetes. However, the number of children who develop type 2 diabetes due to obesity as a result of malnutrition and physical inactivity is also on the rise. Early education and prevention in school and kindergarten should help to prevent this.  Have fun with this quiz.

Superhero Guess is an Alexa game skill, which tells facts about superheroes. And you guess which superhero the fact is related to. Example utterances: To ask a fact, say 'Next fact'. To answer, say something like: 'Spiderman'. To repeat fact, say 'Repeat fact'. To get help, say 'Help'. To check the game score, say 'What is my score now'. To check the game level, say ' What level am I at now'. To get a clue, say 'Give me a clue'.

The latest app, Guess My Fruit V1.0 developed by UofT Engineering Science students! Hardware required: Any voice-enabled Alexa device, with the ability to download skills from the Alexa skills store.  Guess My Fruit is a skill which enables Alexa to guess the fruit you're thinking about. Just think of a fruit, and let Alexa know you're ready. She will ask you a few questions and then guess which fruit you had in mind! There are no accounts, no sign-ups, and no collection of any private information. It is a simple skill which enables kids to engage with a fun game while learning about the wonderful world of fruits! All content including fruit facts, and any images associated with this skill, are original creations :)
Creation Station will prompt you for an animal, color, and sport.  Given your feedback, a wacky story will be generated and read back to you.  Change up your inputs to get a goofier story

Natterbot is an interactive story skill that features a regularly-updated menu of new narratives and chapters for existing narratives. Each chapter will include characters, exploration and problems to solve, all of which either lead to the grand finale or the next chapter in the story. Natterbot features a companion browser experience that allows you to follow the action with a graphical depiction of the world you're exploring. The represejntation unfolds as you explore the world of the story. You can follow your story here: http://natterbot.com

Forever Lasting is a voice interacting survival game where the player takes on the role of a castaway and must survive until help arrives. The player starts the game by saying "start Forever Lasting". The player has an option to listen to a tutorial after the intro to game. The player can scavenge to collect materials to craft and fish to catch fish to eat and crafting to make items which improves your survivability. The three stats are food, water, and energy and the max limit of these stats is 7. If two stats fall down to zero, the player dies. The stats are regained by eating, drinking, or resting. The player must survive for 5 days, doing 4 actions per day (scavenging, fishing, sleeping) and must have 3 beacon items to achieve a good ending. The beacon item is gained by crafting. The minimum hardware requirement for this game is an echo dot. It should work on all other echo devices. This skill's purpose is to provide entertainment while improving memory skills and long term planning.

Voice Tic Tac Toe allows you to play Tic Tac Toe with your voice. You can select a location by saying things like "top", "middle", "up left", or "left up".  It has multiple levels easy, medium, and impossible. You can select the level by saying "change level to impossible".

4 year old tested wiggle game! This is similar to Simon Says but with the phrase, "Cylinder Says". Start this skill by saying "Alexa, open cylinder says" or "Alexa, ask cylinder says to play" and then get ready to get some wiggles out while playing cylinder says. At the end of the round, say "start" or "begin" to play again. This is sure to keep your child/children wiggling and laughing for a while!

The classic game of repeat after me, but you get to pick the words. Alexa will start with one random word for you to repeat and then add to the list of words. See how many words you can repeat correctly! Choose a list of words to have some very funny phrases!

Crazy version of the classic Freeze Dance!  Dance in wacky ways and freeze when the music stops. If the kids are on a sugar rush or just having a crazy indoor day, open Freeze Dancers and let them go on and on and on. This game doesn't stop until the last kid drops! ***UPDATED on April 2019 with a brand new SPACE pack! While playing, try saying ALEXA, DANCE IN SPACE! *** If you like Freeze Dancers, please take the time to leave a review <3 Feedback is also always welcome at pretzel.voice@gmail.com  Check out www.pretzellabs.co for more fun skills and updates!  Happy dancing!  Music by: Ben Sound: https://www.bensound.com/ Purple Planet: http://www.purple-planet.com Audeeyah: https://audeeyah.com/free-royalty-free-music

Get smarter having fun! You're told statments about all US presidents and have to say if it's fact or fake news! After your answer you'll usually be given additional information about the factum behind the statement.  You can compete with up to three of your friends or family members: > If you play alone or with two players, each player gets seven statements.  > If you play with three or four players, each player gets five statements.  Curious? Great! Just try the game and have fun! ** Bug fix: We fixed the problem with the skill's respond time out **

skill_name: Rock Paper Scissors game for Kids (Random Answer)
skill_description: Responds with Rock Paper or Scissors

Animal Yoga provides kids a fun yoga experience and helps them develop emotional self-regulation skill through imaginative play, breathing, stretching, and healthy movement. It encourages their creativity and imagination, builds their strength and flexibility, increases their body awareness, balance, and coordination, and provides them with emotional regulation tools. NOW WITH OVER 30 FUN ANIMAL YOGA POSES!!! Angelfish, Armadillo, Bat, Bee, Butterfly, Cat, Chameleon, Clam, Crocodile, Dragon, Eagle, Elephant, Flamingo, Frog, Giraffe, Jellyfish, Kangaroo, Lion, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Pufferfish, Roly Poly, Seahorse, Sea Star, Shark, Snail, Snake, Spider, Turtle, Wolf…and more to come! HOW TO USE: - Quick ways to get started - Say "Alexa, play Animal Yoga" and Alexa will greet you and ask you what animal you would like to play. To have Alexa pick a random animal for you, say "Play Random". To get a list of animals, say "List Animals". Say "Alexa, ask Animal Yoga to play Bee" or another animal of choice. Say "Alexa, ask Animal Yoga to play random" Say "Alexa, ask Animal Yoga for a list". Alexa will speak a list of animals you can play. - Navigate through different animals when an animal is playing - Say "Alexa Next" or Alexa Previous" to play the next or previous animal.  Say "Alexa, Random" to have Alexa pick an animal for you. Say "Alexa, Seahorse" or another animal of choice. Clear the space, practice barefoot, and unleash your child’s body and mind! Try to do it as a family and have fun!

Test your knowledge about Space with this fun quiz! You will receive several questions about astronomy, space exploration and our Solar System. Answer with the number of the right answer and try to get as many right answers as possible.

Alexa will be your imaginary friend and hide from you somewhere in the room. You have to find her! *** This game is for young kids/toddlers *** The game starts by asking Alexa to hide and choosing how many tries you want to get to find her. You then walk around the room or point anywhere and ask if Alexa is there until you find her, or you run out of tries. For example, if you are in the living room you can lift one of the pillows and ask "Are you here?". If you like this game please rate it so other people can find it too! ************* How To Parental Pemissions *************** If you ***already enabled the skill*** and Alexa says "To use hide and seek skill, a parent needs to give permissions. To do that I sent some information....": 1. Open the Alexa app. 2. Click 'home'. 3. Refresh (drag down from the center of the screen).  4. Click 'Give Permission'. This will open the skill page.  5. Disable the skill, then enable again and follow the instructions below. If you ***haven't enabled the skill yet***: 1. Enable the skill on the app (find the skill by searching, click 'Enable To Use'). 2. If a sign in page opens, log in to amazon with your regular password (this might not happen if you are recently logged in). 3. The next screen should say "Your permission will apply to the following profiles: ..." and your profile should appear just above the 'Continue' button. 4. If you want to add permissions for kids click 'Add Child' and add a child accounts. 5. If **your** profile doesn't appear, it's possible Amazon thinks you are the child on the family account (age is irrelevant, you can stay young forever!).     You can try adding yourself, or calling Amazon customer service. 6. Click 'Continue'. 7. Verify you're an adult. Amazon may ask you to add a credit card to verify you are an adult. You'll need to add a credit card and billing address.     If you already added a credit card you might just need to input the cvv number again. 8. Read the 'Parental Consent' text, click 'I agree'. 9. You should see 'Thank You. Your parental consent has been saved. Your skill has been enabled. ... You can close this window by pressing "x" at the top.' 10. After you close the window you should see 'Enabling skill...' that eventually turns into 'Disable Skill' once the skill is enabled. 11. That's it, you should be able to use the game now. **** If anything goes wrong, or you are not sure about these instructions, please give Amazon customer service a call. I hope you enjoy this game.

A game for kids who can count to 10 and want to improve their understanding of numbers. In 10 rounds, Alexa asks which of two numbers is bigger. Test if your child is interested by the questions: ‚Which number is bigger, five or seven?’ If your child asks for more questions, leave it to Alexa.   Attention: Alexa only understands a clear pronunciation of the numbers. Stay with your child for the first few attempts during the game to avoid any disappointment if Alexa doesn’t understand what they are saying.

This game skill pays homage to one of the earliest computer games, "Lemonade stand". This version is completely redone from the ground up, attempting to enhance but maintain the spirit of the original game in a voice-only experience. This game skill simulates owning a lemonade stand. Alexa states the weather forecast for the (simulated) day and then the player buys cups of lemonade to sell, buys signs for advertising, and sets a price for a cup of lemonade. The skill provides clear instructions what's expected of the player. The game goes on forever. You will earn "experience badges" as you accumulate playing time and earn money selling lemonade. This is a great game for children, parents to play with their children or educators in a classroom. The game focuses on the following player skills: careful listening, math, money, business, understanding odds and chance statements, and managing expectations. At any time you can ask "what's the weather" or say "tell me the weather" to have Alexa repeat the weather forecast. You can find out how much money you've earned by asking "how much do I have" or "how much money do I have". To have the simulated game day number repeated, you can ask "what day is it" or "what's the day". To see what badges you've earned, say "Alexa, badges". You can ask for contextual help by saying “Alexa, help”, immediately go to the next simulated day by saying “Alexa, next day”, or stop the game by saying “Alexa, stop” or "Alexa, cancel" to end your game. Your current scores and badges are saved unless you reset your game or disable the skill. You will start with five dollars. If you go under two dollars, you will automatically be bumped back up to five. If you want to reset your game to the beginning (without disabling the skill and enabling it again), you can say "Alexa, clean slate" and then repeat the magic words Alexa tells you to say. Tip: When you say a price for a cup of lemonade, include the words "dollars" and "cents" where appropriate. Good examples are, "a dollar", "a dollar twenty-five", "two dollars and twenty-five cents", "seventy-five cents". Want to suggest features or report issues with Lemonade Stand? Please contact us by pressing the "Send Message" button at: https://www.facebook.com/LemonadeStandSkill

Welcome to quick turn, a two player competition! First, each player will register as either player one or two. Both of you will then start by facing away from each other. I will then start to count down from three to one. After each number, you will both take one step away from each other, and on one you will both turn around, point at each other, and yell bingo. Afterwards, I will determine who had the quickest turn!

Memory challenge tests your memory skills by giving you five random words which you have to memorise and then asks you some questions whose answers lie among the words that were given by Alexa in the beginning of the game. During the course of the game, you can use the following phrases while playing: 1. To repeat the words given in the beginning, just say 'Can you repeat the words?'  2. To listen to the question again, you can say 'repeat the question' 3. If you don't know the answer, you can pass the question by saying: 'I want to pass this question' or 'I don't know' 4. To start over the game, just say "start again" or "restart"

Play hide and seek with Alexa! Alexa will provide instructions to players, call out a countdown, and act as safe spot to return to. She might also have something fun to say for people who sneak back to her safely...
This game helps kids use reason and deduction to find a puppies family. They can examine a small puppy they found and put up flyers around town to try and help find the puppies family.

Kids center brings a fun musical and learning game for kids to guess the sound of animals, birds, characters etc. Through sound kids learn quickly and become familiar with animal, birds, characters etc.

Tale Spinner skill contains a collection of stories told in an engaging manner. The skill tells the story in parts and asks a question in between the parts. In the end, the skill tells the user the number of questions answered correctly as well as the user's overall standing on the leaderboard. While listening to the story, you can use the following instructions to make the experience smoother: 1. To replay the part of the story, just say 'replay story' or 'play again'  2. To listen to the question again, you can say 'repeat the question' 3. If you don't know the answer, you can pass the question by saying: 'I want to pass this question' or 'I don't know' 4. To restart the game, just say "start again" or "restart" It uses mp3 audiobooks available on kidsaudiobooks.co.uk as source material.

Magic bag is a funny motion game for children. The kids have to run around during the drum roll. When Alexa says Stop, the kids have to curl up into a ball. Alexa then enchants the kids into different animals.

Young Picasso is played by asking Alexa to launch Young Picasso, then asking to start a game. You will be given a unique piece to draw. Then, keep asking for a piece until you have a complete character. When you're done, you can compare your drawing with everyone else who played. This game is fun for artists of all ages.

You are in a virtual room with Alexa, and your goal is to find her without the use of vision. You can shout "Marco" and Alexa will respond back with "Polo". Alexa's voice will be louder if she is closer to you in the virtual room, and softer if she is further away. You can move around the virtual room by saying go "north","east","south", or "west", and say marco to check if you're closer or further to Alexa. When you run into Alexa, you win!

Rebus Puzzles is a game where players are given three rebus* word puzzles to solve each day. Players can ask for a hint or for more time as they work to solve the puzzle.  Points are awarded for each correct answer. Badges are earned as players hit certain milestones. The skill is best played on a device with a display (Amazon Echo, Amazon Spot, Fire TV, etc). Players will need to see the puzzles in order to solve them. Puzzles will be sent to the Amazon App if a user is not using a device with a display. *Rebus puzzles are word picture puzzles that are solved by looking at the organization and arrangement of words, letters, and numbers. The puzzles typically represent a saying, word place, person, or thing.

A game designed for kids to manage flowers. Please see the description to know how the game works.   Start your game by saying "open my garden", system will create a new game for you if you don't have previous game record or load your previous game.  After entering the game, say "report" to get the flowers' initial information. You will start your game with one flower in seed stage and you will have maximum of 3 flowers to manage later.  After your caring, the flower will grow to "germination", "growth", "spreading" stages. Try to keep the water amount  and the fertilizer amount as much as you can by saying something like "water flower number one for five times" and "fertilize flower number one for three times", but no more than 100%, which makes the flower drowned and poisoned. flower will be dried out if the water amount drop to 0%. Each action makes 10% difference in the original amount. Yes! the water amount and fertilizer amount is designed to decrease in real time! Check your flowers the second day you play and get a sense of the decreasing speed. The reproduction will happen in spreading stage and the fertilizer amount will influence the reproduction rate of the flower. The more you keep it to the maximum the more possible it will generate the seeds (check back frequently to see if seeds are generated in this stage!) It takes about 11 days to reach spreading stage. If too much water and fertilizer are applied to flowers, try saying "pour out/dig our water/fertilizer on flower number one".  say "give me a hint" for more secrete game information! say "stop" to save and quit. Only deliberately quitting your game will make game saved! say "check my score" to see your score. If you can't play the game for a period of time, you can say "pause" to prevent water and fertilizer dropping till the next time you open the game During some period of the game stage, your flowers may attract birds to drop seeds in the garden!

Your puppy wants to play hide and seek! He's hiding in the house and needs you to find him. To begin the game, just say, "Alexa, start Find the Puppy." You will start in the entryway and will need to move from room to room until you find the puppy. Listen closely for the colors and directions of the doors in each room. To move to the next room, you can either say the door color or the direction. For example: • open the blue door • go to the left HINTS • Some doors will be open. Those are rooms where you've already been. • Listen for the puppy. The barking will be louder when you're getting closer.
Create a Silly Tale (story).  Alexa will ask you a few question and create a mini story at the end.  There are many different base stories to create your own story.
A game that tests your memory and problem solving skills by selecting different toppings and adhering to the feedback to create the perfect pizza for Alexa.

The Skill is designed to be very simple and co-operative. We will keep on adding more mini-games within the skill. prefered for Kid. To be more interactive with Alexa device and learn from these mini-games and improve their general abilities.

A game to catch all the creatures. Have BoJo catch you a creature including a Gobolo, Weltim, Eggshem, Hooteray, Lipersnap, and a Mitlew that is just a few you and BoJo can catch. Check on your Alexa app, Echo Show, or Echo dot to see the creature caught. New creatures are coming soon. Have BoJo read how many creatures you have and to release the duplicate creatures.

How to play: 1. Everyone stands up at the beginning of the game. 2. Everyone pretends to be an alien, ninja, or a bear. -To be an alien, point your fingers up with your hands at the top of your head -To be a ninja, give your best karate pose -To be a bear, show your claws 3. Say 'Next' for Alexa to make the next choice 4. The last one left wins!

This skill provides a random design challenge for anyone playing with Lego (TM) bricks or other construction toys. It can be used as a one-player challenge or as a competition to see who can build the best. Simply ask The Brick Design Challenge for a new challenge to get started.

skill_name: Fire Water Storm - A Motion Game
skill_description: Fire, water, storm is a funny movement game for kids. The kids should run around and when alexa says fire, water or storm, they have to get safty by doing certain tasks.

Kid Quest is an episodic interactive storyline for children under the age of 13. The application is invoked with the phrase Alexa, start kid quest. Each scene includes one or more questions that affect the storyline. At least one of those questions tests the child’s vocabulary, spelling, or memory skills. Throughout the quest, the child’s progress is saved and may be returned to continue or restart the episode.

Parents can play Santa to leave messages for kids.  Kids can listen to messages left by Santa(parents).  If your kids are too smart, they might figure out the way to play Santa.  You can be creative to use this to say things you don't want to say directly to someone.  I want to use this to have some experience of custom skill development and to have real user feedback.

In this game, your car keys have been thrown into the middle of a lake full of hungry alligators. Your goal is to rescue your keys from the lake and swim out without getting caught by an alligator.  When you open the skill, you will be presented with a main menu. You can choose to play the game, view your item collection, view the high scores, or learn how to play.  During the main game, you have a choice of three actions. You can either swim forward, dive down into the lake, or act like a wooden log.  Each time you swim, it will take you one step closer to your car keys. When you dive under the water, you may find an item to add to your collection or you might find an underwater current to push you further to your keys.  Every time you swim or dive you there will be a chance that an alligator will show up near you. Until the alligator leaves, you are in danger. With each move you make, the alligator may come up and get you! The only way to protect yourself is to pretend to be a floating log. This will fool the alligator.  You win the game when you get back to shore with your keys. Each round you will be awarded points based on how many items you collected, how many gators you fooled, and and how many moves it took you to win the game. Good luck out there. You're going to need it.
Name that Animal. A range of animal sounds for you to guess what the animal is through Alexa.

Parents can play Santa to leave messages for kids.  Kids can listen to messages left by Santa(parents).  If your kids are too smart, they might figure out the way to play Santa.  You can be creative to use this to say things you don't want to say directly to someone.  I want to use this to have some experience of custom skill development and to have real user feedback.

Alphabet Practice lets your child practice the alphabet from A to Z. On easy mode the skill prompts your child to repeat the letter of the alphabet. In medium mode it expects the child to indicate what the next letter of the alphabet is. In hard mode, it randomly asks for the letter that comes before or after the specified letter. In extreme mode, it asks the child what letter is at the indicated position of the alphabet. When not in a game, you can also ask Alphabet Practice to recite the alphabet in a number of different speeds. To hear the alphabet quickly say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet quickly'.  To hear the alphabet at normal speed, say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet'. If you want your child to repeat the letters of the alphabet, you can say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet slowly'. To have Alexa say the alphabet even more slowly say 'Alexa, ask Alphabet Practice to say the alphabet very slowly'.

Help celebrities from past to solve challenges and misteries. To start, just say "Alexa, launch Time Traveller" or "Alexa, open Time Traveller"". At anytime, you can stop the quest by saying "Alexa, stop"

skill_name: Mighty Trivia - a guessing game for kids
skill_description: Are you ready to quiz your way to a top score on the Mighty Trivia leaderboard? Using up to five hints, guess what Alexa is pretending to be to earn big points and take that number one spot! Points are based how fast you can correctly answer, the amount of hints you needed and the level of difficulty. Answer your way through randomly chosen questions across a variety of interesting topics. You get three attempts to guess per question. Say "another hint" if you need it. Alexa will reveal the answer to an incorrectly answered 'easy' or 'junior' level question. Note for Amazon FreeTime Unlimited Subscribers If you are an Amazon FreeTime Unlimited subscriber, you get Tournament mode (play four rounds, with five categories to choose from) and Multiplayer mode (with Echo Button support) included with your subscription. FreeTime Unlimited is an all-in-one subscription that gives kids access to hundreds of hours of fun and educational content on compatible Echo devices, including ad-free radio stations and playlists, hundreds of Audible books, and a growing list of premium kid’s skills. Plus, kids can enjoy thousands of kid-friendly books, movies, TV shows, educational apps, and games on compatible Fire, Android, iOS and Kindle devices at no additional cost.

From the wikipedia page: Ghost is a written or spoken word game in which players take turns adding letters to a growing word fragment, trying not to be the one to complete a valid word. Each fragment must be the beginning of a scrabble approved word, where only words longer than three letters count. The player who completes a word loses the round. Start a round by saying "start". Alexa will add letters to the word fragment, and you will have three seconds to respond. If you would like to hear the word fragment again, say "repeat". If you would like to add a letter, say "my letter is" then your letter.

Funny Alphabet is an adventurous  game that explores interesting themes like space, the ocean and pirates among others.  As each stage is completed a medal is awarded. It is packed with audio effects to keep things both educational and fun. The game remembers where a player is up to, to ensure the content is always fresh and interesting. To start say Alexa Play Funny Alphabet.

Meet the moopeez: These lovely creatures are on a mission to help us recycle more.  In the US, we recycle only 30% of the waste while in France, only 15% get recycled.  This Alexa skill is a simple game based on our larger plan for Moopeez (you can find out more at www.moopeez.com) Help us improve the game:  We know that not every country has the same colors when it comes to their recycling bins so drop us a line so we can make it a better, more interactive experience for everyone.

Take your child on a trip to the Memory Zoo! You will be presented with a sequence of animals and asked to recall that sequence and repeat it back to Alexa. With each correct response, the task will become more challenging. This skill provides both audio-only and display-enhanced experiences.  Whatever device you have, it's Zoo Time!

Calculate 24 is a math puzzle game. For each question, I will give you 4 numbers and your goal is to calculate these numbers and come out a final result of 24. -You have to use each number one time; -You can use operation like plus, minus, times and divide; The game has 2 modes. You can improve your skill in Practice game. Say tell me the answer and I will tell you the answer. In challenge game, you need to give right answers to 3 questions. Say skip if you don't want to be stuck at a question. You can skip up to 3 question in a challenge game. You compete with others for who can finish 3 questions with the shortest time.

This is a conversational Game skill, in which the players must track the art thief. The game starts by reading out a mission statement, in which an expensive museum artifact goes missing. The thief then travels from city to city, trying to sell the art work. The player must follow the thief, based on the clues given by the local police. If the player goes to the wrong city several times, the thief will sell the artifact in the black market and then it becomes untraceable (i.e. Game lost). So, to win the game, the player has to arrive at the right city, at the right time. A good knowledge on cities, countries and continents is needed to win the game. The player (i.e. Interpol agent) can go through a training phase to learn these location before taking up a mission. There are six ranks in the game, as the player solves more and more missions, the rank goes up. The player can play either by difficulty – Easy, Medium or Hard. Or by World Zones – East, Central and West. Context sensitive help is available at all stages of the game. Credits:  Sound effects from https://www.zapsplat.com Music from Bensound.com

The game's rule: The system generates a random number "A", and the player gives a random number "B". The system gives a relationship to "B" and "A", and the player guesses the correct answer from the cue. You can get the game rule tips by saying "help". Family users can recommend this game to their children, and children can improve their mathematical logic level in the game. Now enjoy the fun of the game
See if Alexa can guess your secret number by giving hints of 'Too High' or 'Too Low'!  Alexa can also think of her own secret number for you to guess!

Simpy ask Alexa to start Farm sounds, then Start. Its that easy! Alexa will then pick a random sounds and you need to guess it! Fun for the little ones in your family. Once you got the answer, then say next! Comments appreciated if you find a bug, or just want to recommend new sounds!  Thanks for trying the skill!

A fun and educational game for all ages! Alexa will ask you for 4-10 words and then use them to generate a fun story. Think fast and speak clearly! If you take too long or stutter Alexa might mishear you and include her own goofy word. Unlike Mad Libs and other traditional pen & paper games, Storymaker can remember your choices and use them multiple times in the same story. Plus, you can spend more time thinking about funny ideas and less fretting over articles and plurals - Storymaker will automatically make your word fit the story! With new and original stories published all the time, Storymaker can provide hours of family fun while also teaching kids or English language learners parts of speech and helping their vocabulary grow. Update: Thanks for your feedback! We've added a bunch of new stories to play through and the skill now has over 30 fun stories! We'll be writing new ones every month too.

This is a short game you can play against Alexa. There is a table with a random number of chips. Your objective is to not pick up the last chip. However, there's a catch! You and Alexa alternate turns, only being able to pick up 1, 2, or 3 chips per turn. The game is over when the loser picks up the final chip on the table. Now with 3 difficulty modes! Challenge Alexa on easy, medium, or hard. Easy and medium can be consistently beaten, but the AI on hard mode is much more clever. Will you be the first person to beat Alexa on hard difficulty? Note: To skip the welcome instructions in the skill, just interrupt by saying "Alexa", followed by the difficulty you would like to play.

Rock Paper Scissor for Kids enhanced with Score Keeper, Card Details, Funny speechcons (winner, loser), random selected messages :) Try to Beat the R.P.S. Kid Skill by Saying one option : rock, paper, scissor if needed, You can assign "Amazon Parental Consent page" child permission on this page : https://www.amazon.com/myh/vpc/intro?clientId=Alexa_rw_vpc
Do you want to know what gift you may get from Santa this year. Try Guess my Santa's Gift game

Mariam is a small girl. She like to discover the world. She always needs help from your friends to overcome quizzes and challenges that she can face during her journeys. Join, be a Mariam friend, help her in his journeys and she will never forget your kindness

If you are a fan of the Chicago Bears, this trivia game is for you. It is fun for the whole family of Bears fans. Help you children learn more about the team or play it when your Packer friends come over to annoy them! Created by Bears fans for Bears fans!

The is the game of Nim. The games starts with 20 sticks. The goal of the game is to not pick the last stick.  The user and Alexa take turn picking 1 or 2 sticks. The last one to pick loses. A new game starts immediately after the the current one finishes.

Counting to 20 is a popular game played between two people.  The goal of the game is to be the first one to say "20". Each player can say one, two, or three numbers in the counting order per turn. Each player must start with the number after the last one that the other player said. For example, the first person can say "1", or "1, 2", or "1, 2, 3." If the first person says "1, 2", then the second person could say "3" or "3, 4", or "3, 4, 5". Whoever says "20" is the winner.

Farm Animal - Alexa mimicking the voices of Farm animals like a Cat, Chicken, Cow, Crow, Dog, Duck, Pig or a Sheep. Just keep asking for the animal you want to find like "a cow", "the sheep", "a dog".
Children can play the classic Duck Duck Goose game

A fun game to teach animal sounds to kids during the early development stage. Helps with memory and kills boredom. Just start the skill, listen to the animal or bird sound and reply with its name. You can skip by saying 'Next' or repeat the old one by saying 'Previous' or repeat the existing one by saying 'Repeat'. To terminate and exit the game, say 'Stop'.
An archaeology themed choose-your-own-adventure skill for small children.

This is a trivia about Indian cities and various information related to it. It's a fun trivia which checks your knowledge about India and it's cities. This can be used for fun and education/knowledge purpose. The quiz asks you questions about Indian cities, famous monuments in India, places of interest in Indian cities,  historical sites in India, Indian cities geography etc. It's a light-weight app which can run smoothly on basic hardware. It's one of a kind trivia made specifically to enhance your knowledge about India and it's cities.
Give your brain some work! This skill tests your multiplication knowledge. You get 5 random questions at a time.
Jump start your animal identification career! With this game, you can hone in on your natural animal senses and decipher the calls of the animals!
This is a fun kids animal fact skill. Just ask for a fun animal fact and you will get one to keep your kids entertained and make sure they learn something new.
This is a game where you need to recognize the animal name based on the sound it makes.

I ask you multiplication questions and your level goes up with 8 correct answers. 10 points with a correct answer. 1,000 points with a level up. 1,500 points with a gold. Say "Set Table 3" to get questions only in 3 times table. Say "Set Table 7" to get questions only in 7 times table, and etc. You have privileges in Master level. A gold with 8 correct answers in Master level. Challenge how far you can achieve! Say "Question" to know current question. Say "Gold" to know current gold amount. Say "Level" to know current your level. Say "Score" to know current your score. Say "Random" to get random questions. Say "Restart" to reset your score, level and gold, then to start from the beginning. Say "Stop" to quit. Say "Help" to get help messages. Enjoy the game and enhance your Times Table memory!
Answer as many addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division questions before time runs out! Compete with your friends to see who can get the highest score.
Alexa will throw you a quick Math question, try and answer as fast as you can! Great for the kids and adults alike!

This is a fun skill for kids to help with playing hide and seek. Alexa will help your children count as the others hide. Once Alexa gets to your desired count, the person who is seeking the hidden players will be able to start searching!
Gives general facts about Ms Dhoni a famous Indian cricketer. This helps people to get to know more about Ms Dhoni.

Guess Me is a fun guessing game where Alexa describes something and you have to guess who or what she is describing. Great for kids, but fun for anyone. Start by saying "Alexa, open Guess Me" and she will let you guide you through the game. You can say "help" at any time if you run into trouble and also tips on how to guess the answer. Remember that a parent needs to add permission in the Alexa app to use this skill! You should get a prompt upon your first invocation. I hope you have fun and enjoy playing.

Play the classic kid's game of Mother May I with Alexa!  Start up a game by simply saying "Alexa, play Mother May I".  Once the game is set up, each player takes turns asking 'Mother' if they can take a number of steps.  Be careful though, the larger the number of steps, the less likely Mother will approve!

Solving word problems allow children to apply math concepts to solve real world problems. With this skill, Alexa can help your child practice solving word problems and in the process learn and improve math problem solving skills. Word problems are an important tool for children to relate math to real world problems, and often bring together various math concepts into one problem. It helps your child learn to comprehend the problem when spoken, think visually and use creativity to solve the word problems. Once you ask Alexa - Word Problems skill to ask a word problem, she can keep asking different problems till you choose to stop. You can ask her to repeat the question anytime, ask for the correct answer or ask for a different question. You can also ask Alexa the score, when she will tell you how many questions were correctly answered out of all she has asked in the current interaction.

Answer as many multiplication questions from the 1 - 12 times table. For every question you get right, you get a point. You can always stop the game or start a new one at any time. Good luck. This is a great way to learn your multiplication and have fun doing so.

This skill is a trivia skill to test how well you know Disney's Moana. Just say "Start Moana Trivia" to start a multi-question quiz.  Please Note: Moana Trivia is in no way affiliated with The Walt Disney Company, Disney World, Disneyland, or any of its subsidiaries.

The Bedtime Game helps children know if it's time for bed by asking simple yes or no questions. The responses will ultimately lead to the decision of whether it's bedtime or not. Hint: It's usually bedtime. ;)

Have Alexa tell you what noises various animals make. Great for parents to use with their kids, you can ask Alexa what noise an animal makes as part of a game or if you're just bored of making the animal noises yourself! Fun for anyone who wants to hear Alexa make animal noises :-D Cows say 'moo' Sheep say 'baa'

Have you ever wanted to go back in time and study dinosaurs? What were the differences between them?  Some were carnivores and some were herbivores. Some were big and some were huge. Answer a few simple questions, and this skill will pick which dinosaur most suits you! To learn more about these dinosaurs, just say "Can you tell me more" after the sorting process is complete, and a brief description will be read about the specific species.

Alexa will ask you 5 random multiplication questions from the 0 to 12 times tables.  After each answer, Alexa will tell you if you answered correctly.  After the final question, Alexa will tell you your score out of 5.  If you tell Alexa to stop you won't get a score out of 5.
Simple Kindergarden Math practice. At this point I have included single digit addition. I will add as my kid grows up ;)
This skill tests how well you know the alphabet. You can play a short game to give the location of a letter in the alphabet. Example: What is the location of D? You would reply " D is fourth"

Alexa is designated Simon.  Alexa enable "Simon Says Game" enables the skill. Alexa start "Simon says game" starts the game. Game instructions: Simon tells players what they must do. However, the players must only obey commands that begin with the words "Simon Says." If Simon says, "Simon says touch your head," then players must touch their head. But, if Simon simply says, "jump," without first saying "Simon says," players must not jump. Those that do jump are out. Objective Follow directions from Simon and stay in the game for as long as possible! The last player standing wins.

This is a simple educational math game: two player take turns to count from 1 to 30, at each turn,  a player can only count one or two numbers consecutively. Whoever reaches 30 wins. Game instruction is included in the skill

When you choose your subject, addition, subtraction,  multiplication or division, you'll be given 40 seconds to solve as many problems as you can.  If you can solve 6 questions correctly, you can move on to the next level with more difficult problems. On the menu mode, you can ask 'What's my score?' to track your score. Problems at the higher level will give you more points.

Alexa will give you a list of numbers.  All you need to do is repeat them, but in reverse order!  Most people can reverse four or five digits.  Some can do six or seven.  See how many you can do?  No fair writing them down!
Have you ever wondered where Winnie the Pooh was based or what Christopher Robin really thinks of him? Winnie the Pooh Facts reveals all!

Alexa will tell an interesting Physics fact for your kids with this skill enabled. You can use it to inspire your kids to learn more about science or encourage them to seek for information about what Alexa has just said but they don't quite understand yet. More relevant facts will be added to the pool of about 70 facts at the moment. Credit: Physics facts were curated and edited from http://www.sciencekids.co.nz/.

The questions are related to the events, characters and their preferences in the most popular kids TV series "SpongeBob Squarepants". We play this trivia all the time at home and my kids thought it would be a fun idea to play with Alexa!

A simple trivia game to test your knowledge about Hello Kitty. Start the game by saying "Alexa Start Kitty Trivia". The trivia will give you multiple choice answers. Reply with the number of the correct answer. E.g. Alexa: "What is the color of Hello Kitty's hair bow? 1 : Red, 2: Pink,  3: Blue, 4: Yellow" User: "1" Alexa: "Correct. Your score is 2" Note: This skill is not sponsored or endorsed by Hello Kitty. It is an unofficial (fan) version.

Tell Alexa "Open Activity Book" and Alexa will tell give you something to do. This skill selects from thousands of activities appropriate for all ages. If the first result doesn't sound good to you, just ask again.

It's the classic Hot Potato game--gather the kids, grab a potato-esque object, and start playing! The kids pass the "potato" from person to person while the music plays, and whoever is holding the potato when the music stops is out. Then play another round by asking Alexa again ("Alexa, play Hot Potato") and keep going until there's only one person left! This can also be used for Pass the Parcel, Musical Chairs, or any other game where someone is caught by a sudden stop of the music.
Play rock paper scissors with Alexa!

Musical chairs is a game where a number of chairs, one fewer than the number of players, are arranged facing outward with the players standing in a circle just outside the chairs. Ask Alexa to play Musical Chairs and start in walking around the chairs. When the music stops each player attempts to sit down in one of the chairs. The player who is left without a chair is eliminated from the game. One chair is then removed/eliminated to ensure that there will always be one fewer chair than there are players.

I made this program as a way to practice enunciating individual letters and also have fun spelling out words.  One letter at a time, tell Alexa what letters you want.  For example, "Give me an S." or simply, "an S."  She will remember them in the order you say them.  When you are done asking for letters, Alexa will say the word you spelled out when you ask, "What does that spell?"  I hope you find this skill useful and have fun with it.
Mathematical Trivia. Solve divisions, multiplications, sums and subtractions in your mind, and improve your mental calculation skills.

“Cock-a-doodle-doo” - which animal makes that sound? Listen alone or with friends to real animal sounds and guess the animal. With each correct guess, you advance to the next, more difficult level, and earn a title! Will you be the first to master all ten levels? To launch this quiz, say “Start zoo walk”. During the game, you can say "Repeat", "Stop" or "What's the high score". For further assistance, say "Help".
Challenge yourself with some simple addition.

The Tickle Monster game is designed to reach through the Alexa and into your home for loads of laughs and fun family nights! Just set up a list of participants via the Alexa app (e.g. "Mom", "Dad", "Little Suzie") then ask Tickle Monster who gets tickled next.

Ask SillyThings to give you something to do and it will give you something funny to act out.  For example, "Act like a fish out of water",   "Act like you just ate a really sour lemon", "Do your most silly dance", "Act like you are standing on hot lava", and many more.  You can take turns asking SillyThings for something to do or, like our family prefers, randomly ask for something in order to bring some smiles to the room. This Skill was developed by a husband, wife and their 7 and 9 year old sons who all like to find a reason to act silly every once in a while.  This was a family project to get the kids exposed to programming and we have a goal to make a skill worthy of at least twenty 5 star ratings.
